betterquesting.name: Sky High
betterquesting.desc:
Before you can get started in Applied Energistics 2, you will need Sky Stone. 

To make Sky Stone: Make a Stone Barrel, fill it with Lava, and right click the barrel with Sky Stone Dust. Sky Stone Dust can be found while sieving Dust.

betterquesting.name: Gathering The Basics
betterquesting.desc:
Step one for making massive automated contraptions... Quartz, and lots of it. 

In this world, you will find each of these items while sifting.

There are also some basic tools that are very useful when working with the ME System. The Meteor Compass isn't really useful here but it does make for a pretty nifty decoration.

And finally, the Charged Staff that discharges when a mob is hit with it. Each strike does three hearts of damage. The staff is rechargeable.

betterquesting.name: Control your Drawers
betterquesting.desc: A Drawer Controller will let you interact with an entire bank of connected Drawers. A Compacting Drawer will take Nuggets and turn them into Ingots, and Ingots into Blocks. It will try to always convert items to their most compact form. Wheat, for example, is converted to a Hay Bale in a compacting drawer.

betterquesting.name: Growing more Quartz
betterquesting.desc:
To grow the various crystals used by AE2, you will need seeds. Craft the Quartz Dusts with Sand to get the corresponding seeds. 

The Fluix Seed is made by pulverizing Fluix Crystals and mixing the Fluix Dust with sand.

betterquesting.name: Growth Acceleration
betterquesting.desc: Place a Crystal Growth Accelerator next to a Water Source Block that has an AE2 seed in it, and apply power to the top or bottom with ME Cables. This will slowly grow the seeds into purified crystals. A fully enclosed Water Source Block (four Crystal Growth Accelerators) significantly increases the growth rate of the AE2 seeds.

betterquesting.name: Witching hour
betterquesting.desc: Kill Witches

betterquesting.name: Terminals
betterquesting.desc:
There are several kinds of terminals that can be used with an ME system. 

Crafting Terminals allow you to craft using stored items, Storage Monitors monitor the amount of a specific item you have in storage, and an Interface Terminal will let you remotely access all interface pattern slots in the network.

betterquesting.name: Essentia Storage
betterquesting.desc: Essentia can be stored in special storage cells. You can use Essentia Monitors to keep an eye on the levels. An Infusion Provider can be placed near an Infusion Altar to provide essentia from storage reserves instead of Warded Jars.

betterquesting.name: Molecular Assembly
betterquesting.desc:
Through the use of channels, interfaces, and patterns, you can craft items on demand in the network. To do so you will need a Molecular Assembler. The assembler can be upgraded by inserting Acceleration Cards. 

The Molecular Assembler can act as a stand-alone auto-crafter by placing an Encoded Pattern in the pattern slot and feeding in the materials. Not very efficient but a quicker option when you need multiples of something more rapidly than a normal crafting table.

The ME Interface is exceptionally useful for interfacing with virtually any block.

betterquesting.name: Inscription
betterquesting.desc:
The final things you need before you can get started in AE2 are Inscriber Presses and an Inscriber. The presses can be made by casting vaious liquid metals on a Casting Table. 

Use the Inscriber and make one of each of the processors.

Inscriber Name Presses are made with an iron ingot and either cutting knife. Right click the knife in the air and put the iron ingot into the slot and give it a name. Once crafted, it can be used in an Inscriber to name anything.

betterquesting.name: Basic Network
betterquesting.desc:
For a basic network, you will need an ME Drive, ME Terminal and ME Cables. To interact with blocks, you will need an import bus and an export bus. The ME Level Emitter provides redstone signals for setting up control of the import and export busses.

The drive holds storage cells, which is where all of your items are stored in digital format. Each storage cell holds 63 types of items. 

The terminal allows you to access the items inside the cells. 

The cable provides 8 channels that don't require the use of an ME Controlller and connects the parts. If there are more than 8 items that use channels, the system will shut down.

betterquesting.name: Arcane Crafting ME Style
betterquesting.desc: If you want to be able to craft Arcane objects inside the ME System you will need specialized components.

betterquesting.name: Controlled Growth
betterquesting.desc: The Crystal Growth Chamber will allow you to grow purified crystals without the need for puddles.

betterquesting.name: Thermal Beginings
betterquesting.desc: Soon you will want to make a factory. You will want machines to do all the work for you. To get started you might want to try out a nice Pulverizer. Thermal Expansion has undergone some changes since the last time you visited the void. Machines now need upgrades, and of course you need to choose your upgrades wisely.

betterquesting.name: Auto Smashing
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have your Sieve automated, wouldn't you like to stop hitting blocks with Hammers? With the newly patented Automatic Hammerer you can do just that. For the low rate of six RF/t, never swing a hammer again. Unless you want to. Weirdo.

betterquesting.name: Thermal Transport
betterquesting.desc: Ducts are back. The basic Itemduct is very slow but it will transfer items. To pull items out of an inventory you will need a Servo; to filter items you will need a Filter, and to take items out of one inventory and place them in another you will need a Retriever. This also applies to Fluiducts. Different tiers of Servos/Filters/Retrievers will work at different speeds.

betterquesting.name: Thermal Upgrades
betterquesting.desc: Thermal Expansion machines can be upgraded through the use of better Machine Frames.

betterquesting.name: Simple Storage
betterquesting.desc: Chests are an inefficient way to store items, and very unorganized. Luckily, you have other options. With a bit of wood you can craft Better Barrels. These are not the same barrels as the ones you have been using to compost leaves in; these barrels store things.

betterquesting.name: Automated Lumberjack
betterquesting.desc: The King Lemming found that when players use traditional methods of plank crafting, they waste material resulting in less output. The Sawmill, however, makes precise cuts and multiplies the amount of lumber you get from logs. It can also disassemble and recycle various wooden blocks.

betterquesting.name: Fluid Insertion
betterquesting.desc: Brining a turkey makes it taste much better. Actually, a lot of things are better soaked in fluid. Though not socks. Luckily, there are no socks. There is, however, a device for injecting fluid into things. The Fluid Transposer can make Moss Cobble and lamps; it cannot, however, brine a turkey.

betterquesting.name: Elemental Processing
betterquesting.desc: Turn molten lava and water into Obsidian or Stone with the Igneous Extruder. Or create Snowballs and Ice with the Glacial Precipitator. Control the elements with machinery!

betterquesting.name: Machine Shop Table
betterquesting.desc: A Machinist's Workbench is an excellent start to auto-crafting. Use a Schematic to set the recipe, and store up to three recipes in one table for repeated crafting. While not as powerful as it's older brother the Cyclic Assembler, the workbench is a useful part of the early factory floor.

betterquesting.name: Redstone Copying
betterquesting.desc: Ever get tired of setting every machine setting one by one? With a Redprint you can copy the settings from one Thermal Expansion machine to another. Augments can be put into machines and dynamos to increase their efficiency, speed, and production. However, you can only have so many per machine, and you'll need to make sure the tiers match.

betterquesting.name: Cyclic Crafting
betterquesting.desc: The Cyclic Assembler is the stronger older brother of the Machinist's Workbench. Set the crafting recipe with a Schematic, insert crafting components with your choice of transport, and sit back and watch the assembler create whatever you need.

betterquesting.name: Induction Heat
betterquesting.desc: The Induction Smelter combines two ingredients into a new product. You can use it with Rich Slag or Cinnabar to quadruple the output of your ores. You can also use it to create alloys and components for Solar Panels.

betterquesting.name: Redstone cooking
betterquesting.desc: A Redstone Furnace is more efficient than a regular Furnace. There are some drawbacks, and some things can only be processed in a regular furnace. But the Redstone Furnace is a useful addition to any factory.

betterquesting.name: Magmatic Melting
betterquesting.desc: The Magma Crucible uses high heat to melt things... lots of things. You can turn Netherrack into Lava, Glowstone dust into fluid, and Ice into Water... That last one not being incredibly useful...

betterquesting.name: Smash... Bash
betterquesting.desc: The Pulverizer is capable of shattering ores down into dust. In the process of doing this, it manages to extract more resources from ores than traditional processing. When using a Pulverizer in the void, you can triple your ore output.

betterquesting.name: Water from air
betterquesting.desc: An Aqueous Accumulator gather the small amount of water vapor in air and compresses it for bucketing. This provides a slow but useful method for supplying water to farms and machines.

betterquesting.name: Hyper Charging
betterquesting.desc: The Energetic Infuser can take power from Dynamos and Reactors and use it to charge ... anything you might need to charge. Tools, weapons, capacitors. Just stick them in, power it up, and watch it replenish their energy.

betterquesting.name: Teleportation
betterquesting.desc: The Tesseract uses mystical technology to transfer items, fluids, and energy across space, and possibly time. If you were to try and do this on your own, the void residents might rip off an arm. The Tesseract accomplishes this through the use of invisible gremlins. Most of them survive the trips.

betterquesting.name: Fast Cobble
betterquesting.desc: Need a lot of cobble? Not yet? Well, maybe later. But when you do there is an augment for that too.

betterquesting.name: Fishing ... away
betterquesting.desc: Love seafood? Hate fishing? The Fisher is the solution to your problem. Place it directly over water, apply power, put some item collection device like a chest on top and come back later to collect the fish the invisible hamsters leave for you.

betterquesting.name: Relaxing
betterquesting.desc: One of the first ways to get food is to make a fishing pole, set up a water area, and relax while reeling in fish. Then, combine with a light butter sauce and a pan for lightly grilled fish fillets.

betterquesting.name: Laser Mining
betterquesting.desc: The Jaded One thinks it's silly that people believe there is nothing to mine in a void. Appropriate amounts of power, combined with high tech tools, can generate something out of nothing. Set the Laser Drill in the center pointed at the void, the higher up the better. Place up to four Laser Drill Prechargers around the drill, and when correctly aligned through whacking them with a wrench, lasers will appear between the prechargers and the drill. Apply power to the prechargers and some form of item collection on top of the drill. You can increase your chances of getting various ores by inserting laser filters in the drill. Different colors increase your odds of getting different ores.

betterquesting.name: Industrial Waste
betterquesting.desc: This whole world was destroyed by reckless creators, so now we must use everything, even industrial waste. Sludge is a by-product of harvesters. Sludge Boilers purify the sludge and turn it into various useful things. Don't stand too close though, the fumes are poisonous.

betterquesting.name: Factory Farming
betterquesting.desc: A Planter can plant any crop. When paired with a Harvester, the Planter forms a basic farm. A basic Planter will plant a 3x3 square centered on the planter. The Planter needs to be one block below the level of the farm. A basic Harvester will harvest a 3x3 area directly in front of it. Upgrades extend the working radius of the machines.

betterquesting.name: Organic Fertilizer
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have collected the Sewage, you can put it through a Composter to make fertilizer. Insert the fertilizer in a Fertilizer near a farm and watch your crops growth increase, just make sure to wash them before eating.

betterquesting.name: Sewage
betterquesting.desc: Sanitation is a dirty topic, but someone has to do something about it. Villagers, animals, even you, all produce sewage. Of course you can't see it without a Sewer to collect it. Collecting it means you can use it in industrial solutions. Sewer ranges cannot overlap or both sewers will fail, so pay attention when upgrading them.

betterquesting.name: Auto-Magic
betterquesting.desc: Still have left over mob Essence? Try using the Auto-Disenchanter or the Auto-Anvil to create enchanted books. The Auto-Brewer can keep potions in stock as long as it has the ingredients.

betterquesting.name: Mob Spawning
betterquesting.desc: Assuming you have been using a mob grinder, you probably have a bit of mob Essence laying around. Or, you could always pull some yourself with a syringe and bucket. Once you have some spare mob Essence, take a reusable Safari Net and capture a mob, put the mob in an Auto-Spawner, apply power and mob Essence, and enjoy your mob clones.

betterquesting.name: Meat Packing
betterquesting.desc: If you are using a Slaughterhouse, you probably have a lot of ooey gooey liquid Meat. The Meat Packer will turn that liquid into delicious Raw Meat Ingots. There may be the occasional finger or tail in the meat, but it's been sterilized and the cat says it's tasty. And cats are trustworthy... right?

betterquesting.name: "Passive" Mobs
betterquesting.desc: When the world exploded many of the mobs became very unhappy. As such, there are very few truly "passive" mobs. Squids and ocelots are about it. However, unless you are vegan, you are probably going to need some parts from the formerly passive mobs. Luckily, the Jaded One has added ways to get mob spawn eggs. Just be careful where you put the mobs. If you are feeling very brave, the Jaded One has done some magic that will allow mobs to spawn. But to get "passive" mobs to spawn, you will need an area of grass, 6x6 should do it, around 25 blocks away from yourself. Mobs are shy and don't like spawning near players.

betterquesting.name: Bee Shelter
betterquesting.desc: One of the first things your new bee minions will need is shelter. Apiaries mimic the hives you smashed to get them. The Jaded One wants the bees to be happy, so make them new homes.

betterquesting.name: Attracting Bees
betterquesting.desc: To start into the wonderful world of apiculture, you must first attract some bees. Craft an artificial hive. Then process seeds in a Squeezer to get Seed Oil. Place a bucket of Seed Oil in a wooden barrel and stick the hive in the barrel of oil. Once you have a Scented Artificial Hive, place it somewhere the bees will enjoy - Forest bees want a Forest biome, etc. All bees need to see the sky.

betterquesting.name: Calling All Drones (and Princesses)
betterquesting.desc: Ever needed more drones? Don't feel like making more hives? Feed a Hiveacynth some Mana and collect the results. You may even get a Princess.

betterquesting.name: Stellar Power
betterquesting.desc: Flowers turn the energy of sunlight and starlight into Mana. The Daybloom converts solar energy while the Nightshade converts celestial energy. A few Dayblooms and Nightshades can power your Mana experiments for a while.

betterquesting.name: Begone
betterquesting.desc: Too many drones? Feed them to the Beegonia to power other, more useful flowers, like the Hiveacynth.

betterquesting.name: Forestry Machines
betterquesting.desc:
Several machines are needed to fully process bees and their byproducts. 

A Squeezer turns most seeds into Seed Oil, Honey Drops into Honey; and, with the right recipe, Cobble into Lava. 

A Carpenter is used to make various components. 

A Centrifuge is used to process Honey Combs into Honey and other resources. Some bees have metals and gems hidden in their combs.

betterquesting.name: Bee Gathering
betterquesting.desc: Hives of any kind need to be broken with a Scoop to keep the bees inside alive.

betterquesting.name: Industrialized Apiaries
betterquesting.desc: Industrial Apiaries run on RF, the amount they need depends on the upgrades installed.

betterquesting.name: Frames
betterquesting.desc: Frames are inserted into apiaries for multiple purposes. Regular frames increase production by 20% per frame. The difference between Untreated, Impregnated, and Proven Frames is how long they last. Proven Frames take longer to break.

betterquesting.name: Laboratory set up
betterquesting.desc:
To start messing with bee genetics, you are going to need tools. 

In addition to the tools, you will also need supplies. There are a great variety of traits that you will collect from recycling undesireable bees in the Genetic Sampler.

betterquesting.name: Upgrading the apiaries
betterquesting.desc: Different upgrades can be used to change the temperature and humidity of the apiary, to turn on auto eject, to mimic a specific biome, and much more.

betterquesting.name: Futher Meddling
betterquesting.desc:
If you want to go beyond the bounds of normal mutation, and are tired of putting two different bees together and waiting for the offspring, try the Mutatron. 

Provide it with mutagen by melting Redstone (othere are others...or) in the Mutagen Producer.

Place a Princess and Drone from two different species of bees, or a Sapling and Pollen from two different species of trees. It will give you one of the possible mutations. 

There are rumors of a more advanced version that lets you pick the mutation, but that is probably a myth.

betterquesting.name: Genetic Basics
betterquesting.desc:
The first things you need to manipulate bee genes are machines capable of extracting genes from various sources. 

A Genetic Sampler will sample the DNA of bees and saplings, and put one of the genes from the specimen onto a Blank Sample. Unwanted samples can be baked in a furnace to recycle them.

A Genetic Transposer can copy samples and templates. 

Finally, a Genetic Imprinter can imprint a written template onto a bee or sapling, changing its type and genes permanently. 

Templates are written by combining different samples with a blank template in a crafting grid.

betterquesting.name: Tree Breeding
betterquesting.desc: Treebreeding can be rewarding work. Plant two different tree species near some apiaries. Wait while the bees do some work. Eventually, , while wearing Spectacles, you will be able to see mutated leaves. When you see the leaves change, break them with a Grafter. Analyze the resulting saplings and, with any luck, you'll have a new species.

betterquesting.name: Samples
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you have learned to use the Mutatron and made the Imperial and Industrious queens, it is time to apply that knowledge.

You will need to acquire the appropriate bees and trees to accomplish the following tasks. NEI is your friend, it can tell you what to mutate for the outcome you need.

betterquesting.name: A Seedy Start
betterquesting.desc: Sift Podzol to collect the seeds that will grow mystical flowers. Podzol can be crafted. (Hint: Use NEI to find the recipe.)

betterquesting.name: Sifting for ..ever
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have string you can create a sieve. Sieves can be used to process many materials into other materials. To start with you will be sieving dirt. A lot of dirt. Eventually you will be able to make machines to do this for you, but for now take the block you wish to sieve and right click on the sieve with it, keep right clicking until it vanishes. In return you will get ... something.

betterquesting.name: Flower Baptism
betterquesting.desc: Once you have some flower petals, you'll want to make a Petal Apothecary. If, at any point, you need more information about quests from the Floral One, read the Lexica Botania.

betterquesting.name: Purity
betterquesting.desc: For further progression down the path to natural technology, you will need special stones and wood. Only the purest of flowers can cleanse stone and wood, and return them to their living state. Plant the Pure Daisy and place stone and wood around it for purification.

betterquesting.name: Mana Pool
betterquesting.desc: Mana Pools get Mana from Mana Spreaders fed by flowers that generate Mana. Mana Spreaders can move Mana from a Mana Pool to a Runic Altar or other device requiring Mana. Functional flowers draw power for their tasks from mana pools.

betterquesting.name: Rune Creation
betterquesting.desc: Runes are powerful components. To create them you will need a Runic Altar.

betterquesting.name: Redstone Mana Control
betterquesting.desc: A Redstone Mana Spreader will send Mana based on redstone pulses, this allows much better control of the mana targets.

betterquesting.name: Brewing
betterquesting.desc: Powerful potions with multiple doses can be created using the Botanical Brewery. With reagents, vials, and some Mana you'll be brewing in no time.

betterquesting.name: More Power
betterquesting.desc: Elven Mana Spreaders move more Mana faster than regular ones, without loss. They do not, however, like redstone. It's too mundane.

betterquesting.name: Ore Flora
betterquesting.desc: An Orechid is a great boon on a void world. Using some Mana it can generate common ores in nearby stone. It won't generate anything priceless but it's better than sifting... maybe. It has a cousin, the Orechid Ignum, that works only in the Nether.

betterquesting.name: Hydro Power
betterquesting.desc:
Hydroangeas can produce Mana from water placed in a 3x3 space in front of it. Combine it with some creative water generation from other mods, and you have a wonderful source of power.

Sadly, the Hydroangeas die off from exhaustion and will need fresh plantings. Set up a system to plant fresh ones as they die off to keep your mana production flowing.

betterquesting.name: Vaccum Flower
betterquesting.desc: Do you have items popping out all over the place? Need a way to corral your item drops? Plant some Hopperhocks. They will suck items in and place them in nearby inventories. If you mark the inventory with an item frame, the Hopperhock will sort the items too. It's a very smart mysterious flower.

betterquesting.name: Flower Fan
betterquesting.desc: The opposite of the Hopperhock, the Daffomill pushes items away from it when fed Mana.

betterquesting.name: Alchemite
betterquesting.desc: Much more powerful than the normal TNT, the Soarying One needs some to help clean up some messy chests.

betterquesting.name: Eldritch Dimension
betterquesting.desc: You have heard tales of an ancient dimension filled with secrets. To get there you will need a portal. Thankfully, the Insane One has provided a Portal-in-a-box. Add an Eldritch Eye on each side of the central keystone, and right click with a powerful wand.

betterquesting.name: Hoarders
betterquesting.desc: Start collecting

betterquesting.name: Cobble Madness
betterquesting.desc: Its tradition... get cobble.. lots of it.

betterquesting.name: Chocolate Milk
betterquesting.desc: Tasty drink

betterquesting.name: McAurey's
betterquesting.desc: Cheeseburger

betterquesting.name: Brittled Bones
betterquesting.desc: Kill Skeletons

betterquesting.name: Blue
betterquesting.desc: Cyanite Ingots

betterquesting.name: Cherry on Top
betterquesting.desc: Cherry cheescake

betterquesting.name: Solar Fun
betterquesting.desc: Solar Panels

betterquesting.name: Blank Slate
betterquesting.desc: One of the primary components in Blood Magic are slates. Slates of all kinds. The most basic is made by putting a block of stone in an Altar and infusing it with Life Essence. When it is done infusing, it will transmute into a Blank Slate.

betterquesting.name: Splintered Water
betterquesting.desc: Water splinters

betterquesting.name: BeeNA
betterquesting.desc: Liquid bees..

betterquesting.name: First Steps
betterquesting.desc:
The first step in questing is to understand how to turn in quests. My sweet minions! To avoid overwhelming your little minds, I offer you two to begin: Retrieval (Consume: Yes/No) and Crafting - these are the most common tasks throughout your journey. Turning in quests are easy. The right page contains a task type , an image, and a selector. The task type may be one or more (see the selector arrow at the bottom right) of ten options. When multiple tasks are part of a quest, the arrows become active. Complete the first task and the "Detect/Submit" button below activates. For this set of tasks: Collect one Wood (any will work; "Retrieval"; Consume: No"), make planks ("Crafting"), turn one plank in ("Retrieval"; Consume: Yes"). Use the right arrow to see that each task is complete. In most cases, the tasks completed are automatically detected and acted upon. If not, press the "Detect/Submit" button to submit your offering.

Once all the tasks are complete, the "Claim" button on the left page becomes active. If it doesn't, the "Claim" page may contain up to FIVE reward options. When offered "Choice" rewards, select one of the offerings. Only then will the "Claim" button activate. If more than one reward is part of completing a task, the right arrow activates. Claim all your rewards and reap the... benefits... of your choices.

betterquesting.name: Getting Equipped
betterquesting.desc: To get started you will need to prepare various crafting blocks and some basic tools.

betterquesting.name: Resource Grind
betterquesting.desc: The Great Ones have implemented several methods by which you can get resources. While there is no world to mine, if you convert plant life into dirt and sift it, you can strain out small amounts of various resources. To do so you will need some more specialized machines.

betterquesting.name: Strings Attached
betterquesting.desc: The first resource beyond wood that you will have to gather is string. There are not, however, any handy sheep or string plants around here. Instead, you will need to make Crooks and use the Crooks on tree leaves until you get a Silk Worm. Once you have obtained a Silk Worm, use it on leaves to infest them. Waiting until they are fully infested and then breaking them with a Crook will provide you with String.

betterquesting.name: Hammer Time!
betterquesting.desc: Well! Congratulations! You have learned to make Cobblestone. That gets you one step closer to having resources that are actually useful. First things first, you are going to need to build up some arm muscles with a Hammer. Breaking Cobblestone with a Hammer will produce Gravel, breaking Gravel produces Sand, and breaking Sand produces Dust.

betterquesting.name: Singing in the Rain
betterquesting.desc: To make a smeltery you will need Clay. There does, however, seem to be a surprising lack of swamps in the void. The Insane One thought of this and provided a method to get clay. You will need to mix water with Dust in a barrel. Depending on how the RNG gods are feeling, you may or may not have gotten rain. If you did, and you had some empty barrels, you now have barrels of water; right click them with a block of Dust to create Clay. If you have not had rain, or you have and you did not catch it in a barrel, look for an item you should have gotten as a quest reward. The Rainmaker is a block that, when placed, will trigger a rainstorm before vanishing. It is single use only. Use it wisely, there may be explosive consequences.

betterquesting.name: Old MacDonald
betterquesting.desc:
Hoes do not work in this realm, as you may have already found out. As well, just tilling the ground is not enough to grow crops. The land is tired and crops need love and support if they are going to fight off weeds and reward your care with bushels of produce.

Till soil using a Mattock. In addition to Dirt, Crop Sticks can be placed on Tilled Soil, Sand, Mycelium, Podzol, or any valid dirt. To spread crops where extra seeds are not yet available for planting, place a Crop Stick next to the mature crop, and right click it with another Crop Stick. This configuration is called (oor so it's been heardr) a Cross Crop and allows the parent plant to spread. A faster way to place a Cross Crop is to shift right click the soil.

betterquesting.name: Mary had a little ...
betterquesting.desc: Mob parts are frequently needed for esoteric purposes, as well as for eating. To get mobs you will need to build a place for them to spawn. One typical basic mob tower is 27 blocks high, contains a hole in the center, and has water pushing the mobs down a drop to their death. Some mobs, however, may need a higher drop. Walling off your mob spawning area is not a bad idea. There are multiple ways to improve this type of farm, and even automate it later on.

betterquesting.name: Now We're Cooking
betterquesting.desc: Most foods get better not with age, but with the proper application of fire. Since Cobblestone is at a premium, make a Slab Furnace to save resources.

betterquesting.name: Millstone
betterquesting.desc: Wheat can be turned into Bread. However, unprocessed Wheat is very inefficient as an ingredient. You will get more out of your farm if you grind the Wheat with a Mortar and Pestle. Bread can be baked into Toast with the application of a little heat. This magically adds a bit more nutrition. We're not really sure how, but it does.

betterquesting.name: Metallic Collection
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have Gravel, Sand, and Dust, you can seive them to get small amounts of ore fragments. Combining four identical ore fragments will get you a block of that kind. Start by sieving gravel.

betterquesting.name: Lumberjack
betterquesting.desc: You are probably very tired of chopping down trees by now. Luckily, once you have some redstone and a bit of stone, you can create a machine that will use TiCon tools to chop trees. Place saplings, a hatchet, and fuel (charcoal or coal) in the machine next to a block of dirt. The Stone Chopper will plant a sapling, wait for it to grow, and chop it down. It will collect the dropped saplings and wood.

betterquesting.name: Auto Mining
betterquesting.desc: Are you tired of mining cobble yet? Do your fingers ache from clicking over and over? Why not try a Miner? I know, I know, there's nothing to mine. But if you upgrade the miner with a CobbleGen upgrade and feed it coal or charcoal, it will produce lots of cobble for you.

betterquesting.name: Molten Stone
betterquesting.desc: To get lava you will need to melt cobblestone. To melt cobblestone you will need a crucible placed over a heat source. Currently, your best heat source is a torch.

betterquesting.name: Alternative Containers
betterquesting.desc: It will take a long time at this rate to get cobblestone if all you do is sift dirt. A basic cobble gen using Lava and Water would be very handy. But to move the Lava, you will need a container, and you probably don't want to waste iron on a Bucket right now. Clay Buckets can move Lava once. After placing the Lava, the Bucket will break. You can use the Clay Buckets to move Water as much as you want.

betterquesting.name: Petal Wealthy
betterquesting.desc: Tending your garden of mystical flowers is a worthy task. Spending your days idling in the sun, pruning petals, who could ask for more? The Dreaming One does! The Lexica Botania shares with you a way to grow tall mystical flowers. These beauties have twice as many petals as normal mystical flowers. As proof you've found the answer, make lots of petals! Just make sure to use shears as these beauties are delicate.

betterquesting.name: Power Drive
betterquesting.desc: Before you can get very far with automation you are going to need some power. The most basic power option is a Stone Generator. Add some fuel and watch the power trickle out a very slow rate of 40RF/t. The Stone Generator gets very hot so be careful. Better materials hold the heat in better.

betterquesting.name: Playing with Dolls
betterquesting.desc: Porcelain clay can be used to make dolls. Dolls can be infused with different ingredients to summon various mobs.

betterquesting.name: Blazes
betterquesting.desc: Blaze Powder and Blaze Rods are very important ingredients. If however you would prefer not to fight your way through the nether right now, you can combine an Angry Doll with a stone barrel of lava to get a blaze of your very own. Be careful though, they like burning things.

betterquesting.name: Creepy Friends
betterquesting.desc: Endermen are creepy, but they drop Ender Pearls, which are lovely and useful. Combine a Creepy Doll with a barrel of witch water and you can have your own enderman infestation.

betterquesting.name: Magical Water
betterquesting.desc: Mystical things occur when you leave water laying around in barrels. If you place a barrel of water on top of mycelium and wait, it will become witch water. Witch water can be bucketed and used for all kinds of interesting things.

betterquesting.name: Netherrack
betterquesting.desc: Netherrack can be created by right clicking a stone barrel of lava with redstone dust.

betterquesting.name: Mossy Repair
betterquesting.desc: Mossy cobblestone is useful for several things. Making mossy cobble requires a barrel of water sitting on cobblestone and a lot of waiting. Eventually the water will leak out and moss will grow on the cobble.

betterquesting.name: Soul Sand
betterquesting.desc: Right clicking a barrel of witch water with sand will create soul sand, for whatever evil purpose you might have in mind.

betterquesting.name: End Stone
betterquesting.desc: If you really dislike The End, but you really need endstone, you can create endstone by right clicking a lava-filled stone barrel with a piece of Glowstone.

betterquesting.name: The End is a lie
betterquesting.desc: You may have noticed there are no strongholds. Or if you didn't notice, you might have guessed. And if you didn't guess, I am telling you, there are no strongholds. So how does a fine young adventurer such as yourself get to the end? End Cake. Tasty teleportation. You can refill your cake by right clicking on it with Ender eyes.

betterquesting.name: Mycelium
betterquesting.desc: Sift enough sand and you can get ancient spores. Ancient spores can be used on dirt to create mycelium.

betterquesting.name: Automatic Sieving
betterquesting.desc: You are probably getting very tired of rightclicking on the sieve. You may have already attempted using some form of block clicker to automate the sieve only to find out the Jaded One is evil and has disabled that type of shenanigan. The correct method of automating sieves is to use the handy dandy auto sieve. Catchy name right? It requires power, ten RF/t to be exact, and it can be upgraded with fortune and speed upgrades.

betterquesting.name: Crushing Blow
betterquesting.desc: Some blocks can be broken with a hammer and turned into other blocks that can then be sifted for different materials. Crushed Netherrack can give you ghast tears as well as ore chunks.

betterquesting.name: Sifting Grass
betterquesting.desc: More than just dust and sand can be put through the sieve. You can get special saplings by sifting Topiary Grass, and oreberry bushes by sifting stone.

betterquesting.name: Auto Processing
betterquesting.desc: The AutoPackager will combine items in a 3x3 or 2x2 pattern. It takes items from a chest on its left, crafts them, and places them in a chest on the right. It requires RF to run. You can swap between 2x2 and 3x3 by sneak right clicking the machine with an empty hand.

betterquesting.name: Automated Tedium
betterquesting.desc: The first item for making your crafting life less of a drag is the crafting frame. Place it on a chest, barrel, or other inventory that contains the resources you want to craft. Sneak and left click to open the gui and set the recipe. Now as long as the inventory has the materials, you can craft the recipe you set. Right click will craft 1. Sneak right click will craft a stack. Left click will break the frame.

betterquesting.name: Workshop Table
betterquesting.desc: The Workshop Table can have up to four modules inside in any combination of furnace or crafting table. A crafting table module can be upgraded to be an auto crafting table, to have extra storage space a furnace module can be upgraded to have a input queue. Both the table and the furnace can be upgraded to store charges for later instant processing and to process faster. The Workshop Table itself can have global upgrades applied that affect all modules inside.

betterquesting.name: Void Box
betterquesting.desc: By now you may have some things you want to get rid of. A Trash Can is a useful device for depositing unwanted items into the void.

betterquesting.name: The Ultimate Quest
betterquesting.desc: Finally, you have learned as much as is needed to complete the ultimate test. The Jaded One has determined that to complete this journey you will need to turn in a supply of these mystical experiences for the Jaded One to pass out to the great mystics. With any luck, this shall restore the world.

betterquesting.name: Upgrading the farm
betterquesting.desc: MFR machines can be upgraded in range, with a few exceptions. Each upgrade extends the range of the machine by a different amount. An Iron upgrade is perfect to start for a small farm since it is exactly the amount of space a block of water can hydrate. Make sure your harvester and planter have the same level of upgrade.

betterquesting.name: Specialized Upgrades
betterquesting.desc: Barrels can also have other upgrades applied. You can add Void upgrades that will delete all items that enter the barrel once it's full, Redstone upgrades that output a redstone signal when a barrel is full, and Hopper upgrades.

betterquesting.name: Ender Tank
betterquesting.desc: Ender Tanks are a multiblock tank capable of storing massive amounts of fluid, 128 buckets per interior block to be precise. Always use a wrench to dismantle tanks - when using a wrench the tank will warn you if you're making the tank too small or will lose fluid. An Ender Tank can be 3x3x3 up to 8x8x10 in size. Ender Tank Frames are used for the frame. One frame block needs to be an Ender Tank Controller. You will also need an Ender Tank Valve and Ender Tank Energy Input somewhere on the exterior walls. The sides of the tank can be Ender Tank Glass or Frames. To input or extract fluid you must supply the Energy Input with power. One RF = one mb moved.

betterquesting.name: Plastic not Paper
betterquesting.desc: If you have more plastic than you do metal you might want to consider a Plastic Tank for your fluid storage needs.

betterquesting.name: Infinite Power Transport
betterquesting.desc: Fluxducts transmit different amounts of RF depending on their tier. The top tier fluxducts can transfer as much energy as you can generate.

betterquesting.name: Reactor Power
betterquesting.desc: A reactor is a multiblock structure consisting of fuel rods, frames, and control blocks. A reactor's max size is 16x16. It will require fuel and coolant to produce power.

betterquesting.name: Top tier Generation
betterquesting.desc: The top tier generators can output 64 times the energy of a single generator. While mildly expensive and time consuming to make, you can compress a stack of generators into a single block of space.

betterquesting.name: Ritual Magic
betterquesting.desc: Rituals cause powerful effects when used correctly. Most rituals will require a nice stock of Ritual Stone and some inscription tools. Rituals can create infinite water springs, grow crops, push mobs away, and much more.

betterquesting.name: Blood Storage
betterquesting.desc: Blood Tanks can store any fluid. The base level stores 16 buckets per tank. When broken the fluid will remain inside the tank.

betterquesting.name: Accessorize Minions
betterquesting.desc: Several accessories are available to make your minions more stylish. A Fez helps Golems repair faster, Spectacles let them have a larger range, and Iron Plating protects the Golem from harm while also slowing them down.

betterquesting.name: Splitting Essentia
betterquesting.desc: With an Alchemical Centrifuge you can split advanced essentia down into its base components.

betterquesting.name: Programming the Farm
betterquesting.desc: Multifarms are configured using circuit boards. Right click on the ground with a soldering iron, and place the circuit board you want to program in the iron. You will need to add electron tubes to tell the farm what to grow. When you open the circuit board with the iron, the top slot is North, right is East, bottom is South and left is West. The tube placed in the slot will tell the farm what it should be planting and harvesting in that specific direction. Managed farms will place the soil and harvest the crops. Manual farms will only plant and harvest; you will need to place the soil yourself. This is a good method for farming sugarcane. You can mix and match farm types.

betterquesting.name: Milking It
betterquesting.desc: Milk comes from cows. Or from soybeans. But the easiest method is cows. Well.. sort of. Cows aren't exactly friendly. We suggest putting the cows behind a sturdy fence and being very careful when milking them.

betterquesting.name: Blood Letting On The Go
betterquesting.desc: The Blood Letter's Pack is a way to collect Life Essence without standing over a Blood Altar. So, go about your business of doing other things. While worn, the pack will draw Life Essence from you until you have 1/2 of your hearts remaining. Once full (10,000 LP), you can then regain your full hearts. To drain the pack, place it in the Blood Altar.

betterquesting.name: Manyullyn
betterquesting.desc: Manyullyn level tools are the highest tier you can get. At this point you can harvest anything.

betterquesting.name: Block Extension
betterquesting.desc: Block Extenders are placed on an inventory by sneaking and right clicking. Once placed it will put items, fluids, and energy into the connected inventory as long as its compatible. There are several types of block extenders, the most basic of which just puts items in the first available slots. Filtered extenders can set specific items as acceptable or not acceptable. Advanced block extenders can spread items across the inventory, set a stack size per slot and specify which side to output to. The highest tier is the Wireless block extender which functions as an advanced filter extender from up to 16 blocks away.

betterquesting.name: Blood Staff
betterquesting.desc: The Blood Staff is the weakest staff in power storage, but also the fastest. There are drawbacks to the speed, if you aren't careful it can and will take all of your LP including the last breath in your body.

betterquesting.name: Eldritch LP
betterquesting.desc:
A story told by the Eldest One: "The most powerful mages combined blood magic with eldritch lore and created an orb capable of storing 80,000,000 LP. How do you fill it? Not my problem. I suggest chickens. Lots of chickens." Yep. Story-telling is NOT one of the Eldest One's skills. To be sure, very few ever attain the Eldest One's august supremacy of Blood Magic.

The final in the tier of orbs is the Eldritch Blood Orb. Fill a Tier 6 Blood Altar with at least 200,000 LP and throw in a Crystal Cluster. The Crystal Cluster will absorb the Life Essence and transmute into the Tier 6 Eldritch Blood Orb. To activate, right click the orb in air.

betterquesting.name: Lava Rafting
betterquesting.desc: There may not be anywhere in the overworld for boating, but a Thaumium Boat will let you turn the nether into a yacht club... just ignore the pesky members.

betterquesting.name: Automating Inventory
betterquesting.desc: You will need at least two more items as well as some minion labor to automate the Inventarium. Unseen Scribes can track distant inventories. And the Requisition Tome ...requisitions things.

betterquesting.name: Animation
betterquesting.desc: Bored of metal and stone Golems? Want a cake Golem? Or a cactus Golem? Create an Animation Focus for your wand. Follow the instructions carefully and soon you can have an army of unique minions.

betterquesting.name: Dimensional Explorer
betterquesting.desc: There are many different dimensions available to explore. Why not try finding some of them?

betterquesting.name: Hand Grinding
betterquesting.desc: You probably do not have a lot of materials yet. And certainly not enough to start factory processing your materials. However, the Energetic One has provided a more manual method. With a Quartz Grindstone and a crank, you can turn grain into Flour, ores into dust, bones into powder and much more. It just takes a bit of grinding.

betterquesting.name: Hunting Monsters
betterquesting.desc: The hostile mobs in this world greatly outnumber the friendly ones. Try and lower that number a bit.

betterquesting.name: The Nether!
betterquesting.desc: It's time we visit the nether... Don't you think?

betterquesting.name: Dire's Nemesis
betterquesting.desc: Direwolf hates Endermen. Pesky creatures are always popping in and taking his stuff. Not that he's scared of them, just that they are pesky.

betterquesting.name: Zombie Attack
betterquesting.desc: Kill Zombies

betterquesting.name: Pig Persectution
betterquesting.desc: Kill Pigs

betterquesting.name: Spider Slaughter
betterquesting.desc: Kill Spiders

betterquesting.name: Blaze Butchery
betterquesting.desc: Kill Blazes

betterquesting.name: Zombie BBQ
betterquesting.desc: Kill Zombie Pigmen

betterquesting.name: Sheep Slaughter
betterquesting.desc: Kill Sheep

betterquesting.name: Ghastly Gore
betterquesting.desc: Kill Ghast

betterquesting.name: Magma Madness
betterquesting.desc: Kill Magma Slimes

betterquesting.name: Slime Slaying
betterquesting.desc: Kill Slimes

betterquesting.name: Slime Generation
betterquesting.desc: If you take a barrel of water, and right click it with a bucket of milk, you will eventually end up with a Slime.

betterquesting.name: Hunt The Dragon
betterquesting.desc: The end is a strange place. It is ruled over by an evil dragon. Slay the monster and make the end safe for everyone... except dragons.

betterquesting.name: Brain Bashing
betterquesting.desc: Kill Brainy Zombies

betterquesting.name: Blizz Blitz
betterquesting.desc: Kill Blizz

betterquesting.name: Imp Insanity
betterquesting.desc: Kill Imps

betterquesting.name: Sharp Spikes
betterquesting.desc: Need a way to brutally slaughter mobs? Try spikes. Place them pointy-end up somewhere mobs are falling. Collect the loot.

betterquesting.name: Pointy Sticks
betterquesting.desc: Punji Sticks are a cheap but brutal way of injuring mobs that try to cross them. Combine them with barricades and maybe you might be safe... for now.

betterquesting.name: Mob transport
betterquesting.desc: There are two kinds of conveyor belts. The plastic-based variety will move items, but not players, mobs, or Golems. The more expensive variety will allow mobs to spawn on top and will move them to wherever you want them. Probably a nice safe holding pen, right?

betterquesting.name: Butcher Flower
betterquesting.desc: Flowers can be vicious. The Bellethorne will kill any adult that enters its area.

betterquesting.name: Sacrifice
betterquesting.desc: Blood Magic can be a dark art, if you use it on other people. The powers-that-be advise against taking such an evil route. As long as you are careful and sacrifice your own energy to power the magic, your alignment should not shift too much. The first thing you will need is a Sacrificial Orb and a Blood Altar. Once you have the Blood Altar set down, right click in the air with the orb to siphon off some Life Essence to power the Altar.

betterquesting.name: Alchemical Chemistry
betterquesting.desc: Many things can be made through the use of chemistry. In most cases they are just as good as more "natural" options, with the bonus of multiple uses. To get started you'll need an Alchemic Chemistry Set. With this set you can create leather, potions, and many other things, as well as basic potions normally brewed with a common Brewing Stand (oto be sure, special handling applies when making themr).

betterquesting.name: Faster Than a Sloth
betterquesting.desc: The Speed Rune makes your Blood Altar work faster. Each one increases altar transmutation speed by twenty percent.

betterquesting.name: Upgraded Altar
betterquesting.desc: Your small little Altar will not allow you to do much, you will need to upgrade it to reach more powerful tiers. Pictures of the upgrade layout may help, and if so, WayofTime has provided example layouts on the main forum thread for Blood Magic. The first step towards an upgraded Altar is Blood Runes. You will need eight placed in a 3x3 with no center block, one level down from the Altar. The Altar will be in the center above the empty space and eight runes will surround it on the next level down. You can replace the Blood Runes later with better runes.

betterquesting.name: Imbued Slate
betterquesting.desc: Sticking Reinforced Slates back in an Altar and infusing them with more LP will transmute them into Imbued Slates. Imbued Slates require a Tier Three Altar.

betterquesting.name: Reinforced Slate
betterquesting.desc: Sticking Blank Slates back in an Altar and infusing them with more LP will transmute them into Reinforced Slates. Reinforced Slates require a Tier Two Altar.

betterquesting.name: Sacrificing Yourself and Others
betterquesting.desc:
For those that do not wish to harm other living creatures, the Rune of Self-Sacrifice increases the amount of LP when you prick yourself. Each rune used for upgrading the Altar will increase LP generation by 10 percent. So ten runes will double the amount of Life Essence you get by sacrificing your own health.

Instead of your own Life Essence, the Rune of Sacrifice will do the same when slaughtering mobs, using their Life Essence in your stead. Slaughtering hostile mobs is much more satisfying than mertilizing poor, helpless (ahem) Chickens. The collection rate is the same either way.

betterquesting.name: More Network Space
betterquesting.desc:
Is your Altar too small? Do you need to store more LP than it can take? The Rune of Augmented Capacity should help with that. Each one adds 2000 LP to the amount an Altar will store.

The Rune of Dislocation increases the default rate of Life Essence transfer into and out of the altar. Each rune increases the rate by 20 percent. The cap is 1000 LP/s without the Runes of Augmented Capacity (roor Superior Capacityr) and Acceleration (onot available until tier five.r)

betterquesting.name: Weak Blood Orb
betterquesting.desc:
Most of the mystical devices require Life Essence to power, but it isn't possible to supply all that Life Essence at once. Life Essence donations can be saved for later through the use of a Blood Orb. Different tiers of Blood Orb can hold different amounts of stored Life Essence. Some recipes require a specific tier or higher.

Fill the Blood Altar with at least 2000 LP and throw in a Diamond. The Diamond will absorb the Life Essence and transmute into the first Tier Weak Blood Orb. To activate, right click the orb in air. Then, to fill your Soul Network, toss the Weak Blood Orb into the Blood Altar. Once the current limits imposed by using the Weak Blood Orb are reached, the remaining Life Essence will stay in the Blood Altar.

betterquesting.name: Byrrus
betterquesting.desc: Tier two incense. 'Nuff said.

betterquesting.name: Bloody Redstone
betterquesting.desc: The Altar Emitter can be configured to check for a set amount of LP in an Altar. Once the correct amount is detected, the Altar Emitter will send out a redstone signal to... well that's up to you.

betterquesting.name: Blood Stone
betterquesting.desc: Large Bloodstone Brick is made by combining Stone and Weak Blood Shards. Weak Blood Shards can be gotten rarely by sieving Soul Sand or Heat Sand. You can also obtain them using a Bound Blade when killing hostile mobs with it.

betterquesting.name: Tier Three Sigils
betterquesting.desc:
The Sigil of the Blood Lamp will create slightly creepy light sources out of your Life Essence. It can place these light sources at a distance and, if a mob comes between you and the space the light is aiming for, it will damage mobs and sometimes set them on fire.

The Sigil of the Phantom Bridge will create a bridge for you. 

The Sigil of Magnetism will use LP to suck items into your inventory.

The Sigil of Elemental Affinity provides environmental protection while active: Negates fall damage, applies water breathing, immunity to fire. All use a small bit of LP.

betterquesting.name: Divine Insight
betterquesting.desc:
The Altar Diviner can hold an object. This may seem less than amazing, however, when a redstone signal is applied the Altar Diviner can put that object into the Altar to be transmuted with LP.

The Altar Manipulator will pull transmuted items out of the Blood Altar after completing a single stage. Useful if you need to process lots of stone into Blank Slates without babysitting or fancy filtering systems.

More details can be found in the book "Delving into the Darkness".

betterquesting.name: Tele- whatsit
betterquesting.desc:
The Teleposition Sigil will allow you to sneak click on a Teleposer and set the sigil to that location; you can then go back to the location from a distance using LP.

The Sigil of Transposition will allow you to move blocks, even if you can't break them. You can store them inside the sigil and then place them in the world somewhere else, preferably not in your way.

betterquesting.name: Water Sigil
betterquesting.desc: The Water Sigil can be quite useful in a skyblock world. For 100LP, it will place source blocks in world. Alternatively, it will place one bucket worth of water in a tank.

betterquesting.name: Divination
betterquesting.desc: A Divination Sigil will let you see how much Life Essence is in your Altar or LP network. It also reveals the tier of the Blood Altar.

betterquesting.name: Master Blood Orb
betterquesting.desc: Fourth in the tier of orbs is the Master Blood Orb. Fill a Tier 4 Blood Altar with at least 40,000 LP and throw in a Weak Blood Shard. The Weak Blood Shard will absorb the Life Essence and transmute into the Tier 4 Master Blood Orb. To activate, right click the orb in air.

betterquesting.name: Health Back-up
betterquesting.desc: A Blood Amulet is filled with Life Essence, either in a Fluid Transposer or by using a Blood Tank. The Blood Amulet can heal you for five hearts of damage as long as it is full.

betterquesting.name: Tier Four Sigils
betterquesting.desc:
The Sigil of the Whirlwind deflects projectiles.

The Sigil of Compression compresses any compressible item picked up into block form.

The Sigil of Haste increases your movement speed, jump height, and grants step assist.

The Sigil of Ender Severance stops an Enderman from teleporting. So no more sneaky back-stabbing from Enderman.

betterquesting.name: Blood Cleansing
betterquesting.desc: The Blood Cleanser is a new way of crafting, by soaking things in Life Essence they become cleaner and turn into other things... don't ask me... The Jaded One says it's weird but cool.

betterquesting.name: Bloody Fields
betterquesting.desc: The Bloodthorn will make anything near it suffer from Weakness. Which may make it easier to kill... maybe.

betterquesting.name: Blood Wand
betterquesting.desc: With some work, you can combine dark arts and make a Wand that powers itself from LP. The first person to pick it up will be bound to the Wand core and their LP network will be used to power the spells cast. Maybe you can get someone else to pick it up?

betterquesting.name: Wand Upgrade
betterquesting.desc: The basic Wand won't hold much, and many recipes need more vis than a basic Wand can hold. A Greatwood Wand core can hold 50 vis of each type.

betterquesting.name: Blood Writing
betterquesting.desc: If hunting down squids for ink doesn't suit you, and you don't mind a few paper cuts, consider using Life Essence for ink. It will pull its ink from your LP network any time it is in your inventory. If your network is empty it will refill from you.

betterquesting.name: Alchemical Caps
betterquesting.desc: Caps made of Life Essence reduce the amount of LP needed to charge vampiric wands and staves.

betterquesting.name: Wand Caps
betterquesting.desc: Different Wand caps can affect wands and staves differently. The Charged Thaumium Cap is created by infusing Inert Thaumium Caps with extra vis.

betterquesting.name: Sun Power
betterquesting.desc: If you don't have much fuel, you can generate tiny amounts of power from the sun. This only works if the block can see the sky, and it's not cloudy/rainy/snowy/stormy or nighttime.

betterquesting.name: Dynamic Power
betterquesting.desc: Dynamos can be crafted to use several different fuel types. You can make dynamos that run on steam, solid fuel, liquid fuel, and a combination of solid and coolant. All dynamos output 80 RF/t.

betterquesting.name: Power Transfer
betterquesting.desc: Power needs to be transported too. Unless you just happen to like having a power source attached to every machine. There are multiple ways of moving power: ExU energy Transfer Nodes, Fluxducts, and RedNet Energy Cable. All of them have their pros and cons.

betterquesting.name: Hand Pump
betterquesting.desc: The most basic form of power; hand driven power. Right click the Clockwork Engine to have it output a trickle of energy as long as you are clicking it.

betterquesting.name: Multiplying Power
betterquesting.desc: Generators can be combined with other generators to create more powerful generators. The first tier will multiply the power output by 8. It's like having eight generators in one block.

betterquesting.name: Purple Potion Power
betterquesting.desc: The Potions Generator burns potions for fuel. The more steps a potion takes to create, the more energy you'll get from it.

betterquesting.name: Survival Power
betterquesting.desc: A Survivalist Generator is not powerful, but it is cheap.

betterquesting.name: Food to Fuel
betterquesting.desc: A Culinary Generator can turn food into energy for your machines. The better the food level, the more energy it will produce.

betterquesting.name: Plant Fuel
betterquesting.desc: BioFuel Generators and Bio Reactors can turn almost any plantable item into fuel, and from fuel into power. The more types of items (seeds, saplings, etc) you use, the more efficient the production of BioFuel. BioFuel can also be used in compression dynamos.

betterquesting.name: Water Power
betterquesting.desc: Water heated to boiling produces steam. Pump steam into a Steam Turbine and it will produce power.

betterquesting.name: Mud fuel
betterquesting.desc: If you have set up a sludge boiler, you may already have some peat laying around. That peat can be used to power a Peat-fired Engine.

betterquesting.name: Yellorium
betterquesting.desc: Yellorium can be gotten by sieving Sand, from a Laser Drill, or from Nether Uranium Ore. Once processed into ingots you are on your way to a reactor-powered base.

betterquesting.name: Power Storage
betterquesting.desc: Redstone Flux can be stored in Flux Capacitors or in Energy Cells. Different tiers of Energy Cells can store and transmit different amounts of power. Having a few cells around filling up while your machines are idle will give you extra power when you need it.

betterquesting.name: Power Cables
betterquesting.desc: RedNet Energy Cables can transfer power, as well as Redstone signals, to machines. Combining it with a Programmable RedNet Controller will allow you intricate control over machines with Redstone compatibility.

betterquesting.name: Power Conversion
betterquesting.desc: Want to power your whole factory on flowers? You can. Just send Mana through a Mana Fluxfield - it will convert the Mana to RF which can be transported, stored, and used in any normal fashion.

betterquesting.name: Blitzing Blitz
betterquesting.desc: Kill Blitz

betterquesting.name: Bendy Endyman
betterquesting.desc: Kill Endermen

betterquesting.name: Fermentation
betterquesting.desc: With some saplings and water, you can start creating fuel for compression dynamos and engines. Use fruit juice from squeezing fruits to increase the output.

betterquesting.name: More Wind
betterquesting.desc: Better turbines and rotors give better results. A reinforced Flux Windmill can generate 24 rf/t and stores 48k RF. The Electrum rotor will allow full efficiency. Other rotor materials can multiply the power generation.

betterquesting.name: Wind Power
betterquesting.desc: Wind power can be a viable source of renewable energy. While not incredibly powerful, it is easy to get. A turbine (Flux Windmill) will only produce energy if it is above y60, and it produces it's max energy at y100+. There are two parts, the turbine and the rotor. The turbine determines how much it can generate, while the rotor determines how efficient it is. Sneak and rightclick the turbine to find out how much power it is generating.

betterquesting.name: Rakes
betterquesting.desc: If you have left any empty cropsticks out in your field, you may have noticed some weeds growing. If you are not careful, the weeds can take over the whole garden. You can get rid of weeds, either by breaking the crop sticks or by right clicking on the sticks with a rake. Later on you can mutate your crops to be more resistant to weeds.

betterquesting.name: Chef Tools
betterquesting.desc: To prepare the finest food, you need better tools. A simple furnace is not enough to make cheese or pizza.

betterquesting.name: Metalware
betterquesting.desc: By this point you hopefully have some resources to spare and can make tools that require more than just dirt and wood.

betterquesting.name: Basic Planting
betterquesting.desc: A Stone Planter can plant and harvest almost every crop. A basic planter will only interact with a single dirt block above it. More upgrades allow it to plant and harvest from more blocks. Stone level machines can only use tools made from stone tier materials, such as flint and bone. You will need Iron and Diamond machines to use better tools.

betterquesting.name: Analyzing Mutations
betterquesting.desc: Before you can really get started with mutating crops you need a way to store your findings. A Seed Analyzer equipped with an Agricultural Journal can scan seeds and record the mutations and requirements.

betterquesting.name: New Crops
betterquesting.desc:
To get new species of crops, you will need to mutate common crops through crossbreeding. To improve the chances of a successful crossbreeding, breed the parent seeds to 10/10/10. 

To crossbreed crops you will need to plant one species on crop sticks, leave an empty block suitable for the type of crop you are attempting to get, and then plant the other crop on crop sticks on the other side of your mutation block. Place a Cross Crop on the empty space. This will form a grid. Remember, empty crop sticks and Cross Crops can spawn weeds. A watering can will speed up the rate at which crops grow and mutations occur.

betterquesting.name: Resource Seeds
betterquesting.desc: Many resources can be grown from crops. However, it's a bit trickier to crossbreed these. Under your crossbreeding space you will need to have a specific block. Use NEI to find out what block the resource crops need for mutation.

betterquesting.name: Stone Cold Killing
betterquesting.desc: The Stone Killer can take a stone-level weapon and some fuel to slaughter mobs. Use the appropriate upgrade to tell it what mobs to kill.

betterquesting.name: Stone Farming
betterquesting.desc: A Stone Animal Farmer can be used to breed mobs, and it can be upgraded to shear and milk mobs. Just add fuel and mobs. The mobs must be on the same level as the farmer for it to breed them.

betterquesting.name: Rubber Farm
betterquesting.desc: Before you can go very far in automating farming, you will need to procure some Rubber. Rubber Tree Seeds can be found by sifting dirt. Rubber trees, when chopped down, yield Raw Rubber. Rubber can be converted into plastic. Plastic is the building block for many advanced machines.

betterquesting.name: Mob Breeding
betterquesting.desc: Breed your "passive" mobs from a safe distance. Supply power and food to the Breeder to multiply your animals. Use a Slaughterhouse to turn the mobs into liquid meat and pink slime. Use a Grinder to harvest mob parts. A Rancher can shear wool, collect ink, and milk cows. A Chronotyper can sort the animals by age.

betterquesting.name: Irrigation
betterquesting.desc: A better way to irrigate farms exists. Why deal with blocks of water you fall into everywhere? Instead, build an irrigation system. Irrigation systems are made from Water Tanks, Water Channels, Water Channel Valves to control water flow, and Sprinklers. Tanks are a multiblock, and as long as the water level inside the tank is higher than the water level in the channels, water will keep flowing to the sprinklers. Water Tanks are filled by rain or by pumping water in. Water Channels take water from the Tank to a Sprinkler placed above the area you wish to irrigate.

betterquesting.name: Pressing
betterquesting.desc: The Presser turns fruit into juice, and Soybeans into Silken Tofu, Soy Milk, and Firm Tofu.

betterquesting.name: Upgrading Seeds
betterquesting.desc:
Seeds can be upgraded to grow faster, be more weed-resistant, and produce more. 

To upgrade Seeds, you use either identical plant types or the parent plant types. So, for artichoke you could use two artichoke seeds, wheat and lettuce seeds, or any combination of the 3. Using unrelated seeds will have no effect. The more seeds you have around the space you are trying to get an upgrade on the better.

Alternatively, you can clone the seed with the highest stats by simply placing Cross Crops next to the crop you wish to clone. Then use the clones and the parent to upgrade your crop.

betterquesting.name: Agricultural Flower
betterquesting.desc: Some flowers can help you grow crops even faster, just keep them stocked with Mana.

betterquesting.name: Diabolical Dinner
betterquesting.desc: The Diabolist Fork can be used to kill mobs. If you have a Blank Imprinting Crystal it will infuse it with that mob type. Add the crystal to a Wrath Cage for a handy dandy spawner. Some drawbacks and conditions apply.

betterquesting.name: Runic Magic
betterquesting.desc: The Runic Matrix is a key component in thaumic infusion. Check the ExAstris section of your Thaumonomicon for instructions on how to fabricate it.

betterquesting.name: Increase the Horde
betterquesting.desc: The Jaded One is unsure why you would want more pesky chickens, but just in case you do, try infusing an egg.

betterquesting.name: Taming the Shrew
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have your mobs nicely bottled, infuse them with some loyalty. Once they are loyal they will love and protect you... mostly.

betterquesting.name: Containing the herd
betterquesting.desc: With a Curative Vat (Thaumic Horizons) and a Containment Focus, you are on your way to making nicer animals. Catch the animals with the Wand, and use the vat to infuse them with... things.

betterquesting.name: Changing Flavor
betterquesting.desc: Amongst the many infusion types you can do with your new vat, you can change a cow's natural milk into chocolate milk.

betterquesting.name: Thaumometer
betterquesting.desc: The Thaumometer is used to scan items in the world and discover the aspects that form their structure. Some items' structure may be too advanced for you to learn at first, but once you have scanned enough objects, that will resolve itself.

betterquesting.name: Milking Tanks
betterquesting.desc: If you attach a Glyph of the Bovine to a thirsty tank, it will milk any cows that are on that side of the tank and store their cream inside.

betterquesting.name: Thirsty Work
betterquesting.desc: A Thirsty Tank will pick up fluid that comes in contact with it; if this fluid happens to be a source block of water, it will stay filled with water until the source block is removed.

betterquesting.name: Multifarms
betterquesting.desc: Forestry's multiblock farm structure is another method of growing the things you need. It requires a 3x3x4 structure in the center of a 21x21 space. It can be made even larger (up to 5x5x4 in a 35x35 space) but a 3x3x4 is the smallest. The central structure must include Farm Blocks, a Farm Gearbox for power input, a Farm Hatch for putting things in and pulling them out, a Farm Valve for piping in water. You can include a Farm Control block if you want to be able to turn it on or off with redstone signals.

betterquesting.name: Market Research
betterquesting.desc: The Market block is a big help for people who don't care to research every mutation on their own. Just buy the saplings and seeds you want.

betterquesting.name: Recipe Roundup
betterquesting.desc: With all the ingredients available to cook with, the beginner chef may become slightly overwhelmed and resort to just eating raw ingredients. A handy tool for any chef is a cookbook. Place a book in a furnace and it will transform into a magical tome that can tell you everything you can make with the items in your inventory.

betterquesting.name: Automatic Recipes
betterquesting.desc: After a while, it gets tiresome going back and forth between the book and a crafting table. The solution is to upgrade your book. Add some Diamonds and Crafting Tables to create a book that can not only show you what you can make, it can also craft food from whatever you are currently carrying.

betterquesting.name: Gourmet Kitchen
betterquesting.desc: Ever wanted a kitchen? Of course you did. Place a Fridge, Sink, Cooking Oven, Cooking Table and Tool Rack next to each other and you have created a kitchen that can craft food on command. Just make sure to keep the fridge stocked.

betterquesting.name: Thermal Storage
betterquesting.desc: Caches work similar to barrels but hold more items without the need to upgrade.

betterquesting.name: Portable Fluids
betterquesting.desc: When you want to move fluids, you could make tons of cans or capsules.. or you could make a Portable Tank. A Crescent Hammer can pick up a tank with its fluid contents intact allowing you to carry gallons of whatever fluid you need.

betterquesting.name: Expanding Barrels
betterquesting.desc: Better Barrels can be upgraded to hold more items. To upgrade a barrel you will need to right click the barrel with a Structural Upgrade. Storage Upgrades add slots for more upgrades. Different upgrade types require different amounts of free slots. Once you have applied enough Storage Upgrades, you can add Structural Upgrades. You must have already applied Tier One before upgrading to Tier Two and so on. High enough level barrel upgrades may lead to new discoveries.

betterquesting.name: Filing it Away
betterquesting.desc: Filing Cabinets are another option for storage. A basic Filing Cabinet can hold 270 items with the same ID. This is awesome for things like bees and seeds. An advanced cabinet can hold things regardless of ID, sorted alphabetically.

betterquesting.name: Compact Chests
betterquesting.desc: Compact Chests are made by first crafting a chest Builder. Once you have the chest builder placed, you can decide how many rows and columns you want your chest to have. Add material to the Builder and it will craft a chest or Backpack for you.

betterquesting.name: Strong Storage
betterquesting.desc: Strongboxes have several nifty features. They can be locked so only you can access them and, if you shift right click with a crescent hammer, the strongbox can be picked up with all of the inventory still inside it. They come in multiple sizes, each with a different color scheme.

betterquesting.name: Drums of ...
betterquesting.desc: Drums can be used to store large amounts of fluids.

betterquesting.name: Bilbo's Storage
betterquesting.desc: Perhaps you like taking your inventory with you? Craft some Bags or Backpacks, and you can do just that. Of course, there is a condition. Some Backpacks will only allow items from specific mods or oreDictionary types in them.

betterquesting.name: Water Source
betterquesting.desc: As we all know two blocks of water makes an infinite water source. Or, alternatively, you could craft a nice Brick Well. A well is an infinite water source in a single block.

betterquesting.name: Spiffy Satchels
betterquesting.desc: As an alternative to bags, you also have the option of the very stylish Satchel for storing items inside an inventory inside an inventory.

betterquesting.name: Backpacks
betterquesting.desc: Another option for portable storage is provided by the Bee Lord. Backpacks can be set to auto-pick up items that fit in them, or to auto dump the items inside into a chest. The space is limited. Larger versions require work with bees.

betterquesting.name: Pretty Storage
betterquesting.desc: Storage Drawers are the aesthetic answer to storing items. They come in multiple sizes, and each size stores different amounts. The largest stores 32 stacks of one item. The smallest stores two stacks each of four items.

betterquesting.name: Fancy Upgrades
betterquesting.desc: Storage Drawers can be upgraded to hold more items. You do not need the previous tier of upgrades to apply a high tier upgrade.

betterquesting.name: Router Routing Routes
betterquesting.desc: Router Reborn provides a way of transferring and extracting items from connected inventories. It can access all inventories that are connected to it in a continuous line of inventories. A wall of barrels, chests or caches can all be accessed as long as they are touching each other and one is touching the router.

betterquesting.name: Router Upgrade Route
betterquesting.desc: The Router can be upgraded with several different functions. You can filter what machines/inventories it interacts with, you can boost its speed, you can make it transfer a stack of items at a time, and you can filter items and eject items to a chest.

betterquesting.name: Sorting Storage
betterquesting.desc: Barrels and chests can be upgraded to use the sorting function.

betterquesting.name: Relocation
betterquesting.desc: Relocators are pipes, pipes that can be upgraded. Different modules can be installed to allow filtering, stocking, and even crafting.

betterquesting.name: Tool Storage
betterquesting.desc: Tool Racks, that's what we need, a place to store all our tools.

betterquesting.name: Armor Storage
betterquesting.desc: Now that we have our tools neatly stored, (I'll pretend I don't see that messy chest), let's make a spot to store our spare armor sets.

betterquesting.name: Casting Storage
betterquesting.desc: A Casting Frame can be used in a Fluid Transposer and filled with metals to create storage blocks.

betterquesting.name: Thaumic Beginning
betterquesting.desc: To get started messing with Thaumaturgy, you will need a guide. Click a Bookshelf with a Wand to create a Thaumonomicon. This book will allow you to easily reference all thaumic discoveries you make. Since there are very few nodes in the void, the Jaded One is willing to give you a Node and a charged Wand in return for some Iron Wand Caps. Why she wants them? Don't ask... no really.. don't.

betterquesting.name: Pesky Pechs
betterquesting.desc: I have no idea why you would want a Pech. Pesky critters. But if you do want a pet Pech, make a Thaumium Barrel, fill it with witch water and add a Thaumic Doll.

betterquesting.name: Blizzard Creation
betterquesting.desc: The Blizz is a frozen cousin of the Blaze. To create a Blizz outside its normal habitat of snow and ice, place a Freezing Doll in a Thaumium Barrel filled with water.

betterquesting.name: Farming Minions
betterquesting.desc: For a mage, technology is less than ideal. The Jaded One has been assured that mages like minions, not machines. Luckily, the Great Mage has provided a method to train minions to harvest crops for you. With the right upgrades they will even replant them afterwards. The minions may or may not be slightly evil.

betterquesting.name: Core
betterquesting.desc: The first step in your mission to make minions is to create Golem Animation Cores. They are sort of like souls, but not.

betterquesting.name: Butchery
betterquesting.desc: Training your minions to cut animals into pieces may be a bit gory, but it shouldn't taint your soul... much.

betterquesting.name: Thaumic Minions
betterquesting.desc: Thaumium Golems are tougher and faster than most other Golems, they can also take two upgrades instead of just one.

betterquesting.name: Stone Worker
betterquesting.desc: Stone Golems can carry 16 items at a time and seldom break, but they move very very slowly.

betterquesting.name: Wood Minions
betterquesting.desc: Wood Golems are not overly bright, but they are cheap. They are a bit faster than average. They can hold one upgrade and move up to four items at a time.

betterquesting.name: Clay Soldier
betterquesting.desc: Clay is a material that lets Golems be fireproof, never worry about leaving your Golems near lava again.

betterquesting.name: Job Requirements
betterquesting.desc: To get your minions to do better jobs, you will need to give them better cores. The Fishing Core will allow a Golem to fish, relieving you of that tedious task. Don't worry. Golems love fishing.

betterquesting.name: Boiling in ....
betterquesting.desc: The Crucible is formed by placing a Cauldron in the world and right clicking it with your Wand. A Crucible has many uses, transmuting objects, creating Flux, and soup.

betterquesting.name: Sorting Golem
betterquesting.desc: The Sorting Core is useful. Attach a Golem to a chest and put items in it, now the Golem will search for items that match those in the chest and put them inside.

betterquesting.name: Gather and Fill
betterquesting.desc: A Gather Core will teach a Golem to look for dropped items in its range and place them in an inventory assigned to them. If you right click the Golem, you can set what items it should pick up or ignore. Golems with the Fill Core will search for items in inventories and keep things stocked.

betterquesting.name: Table Craft
betterquesting.desc: The research table is formed by placing two Tables side by side in the world and right clicking with Scribing Tools. If you find yourself confused as to the proper placement, take a look in your Thaumonomicon.

betterquesting.name: Deconstruction
betterquesting.desc: A Deconstruction Table is crafted in the Arcane Worktable. It can tear items apart and, in return, it will give you one of the aspects on the item.

betterquesting.name: Tubes
betterquesting.desc: To move Essentia out of the Arcane Alembic, you could just right click on it with a Glass Phial, or you could attach Essentia Tubes between the Arcane Alembic and Warded Jars. Essentia Valves will let you control which tubes are open.

betterquesting.name: Distillation
betterquesting.desc: An Arcane Alembic is placed on top of an Alchemical Furnace to collect Essentia. You can stack up to five on one Alchemical Furnace.

betterquesting.name: Alchemical Smelting
