betterquesting.desc: An Alchemical Furnace can break items down into Essentia for further processing.

betterquesting.name: Filtering the results
betterquesting.desc: If you want to specify which Essentia goes where, you'll need some Filtered Essentia Tubes.

betterquesting.name: Solidifying the remains
betterquesting.desc: If you want to store Essentia as a solid, you will need an Essentia Crystallizer. Applying Terra vis to the Crystallizer will cause it to crystallize into slivers of Essentia faster.

betterquesting.name: Advanced tubes
betterquesting.desc: Restricted Essentia Tubes lower the suction on a tube segment, this lowers the priority of that tube for getting essentia. Directional Essentia Tubes only allow suction in one direction.

betterquesting.name: Grow Lamp
betterquesting.desc: Set a Lamp of Growth down and pipe Herba Essentia to it, and it will grow all the plants around it.

betterquesting.name: Romantic Mood Lighting
betterquesting.desc: Want a way to get your animals in a romantic mood without risking your life? Add some mood lighting and feed it Victus

betterquesting.name: Fancy Floral Fabrication
betterquesting.desc: Due to a lack of land, which you may or may not have noticed... Shimmerleaf and Cinderpearl are extinct. But with some love, care, and magic, you can make more.

betterquesting.name: Silverwood
betterquesting.desc: Silverwood trees will sometimes spawn a node when grown. In a world where nodes are very rare, this can be quite useful.

betterquesting.name: Greatwood
betterquesting.desc: Greatwood trees are in short supply. You will need to create them by following the recipe in the ExAstris section of your Thaumonomicon.

betterquesting.name: Arcane Showcase
betterquesting.desc: The Arcane Pedestal is a handy way to display objects, or to add special ingredients to thaumic infusion. You can find how to craft it and use it in your Thaumonomicon.

betterquesting.name: Explosive Light
betterquesting.desc: Nitor and Alumentum are used in several magical processes. Nitor can also be used as a delicate flickering light source, its partner Alumentum has an explosive personality.

betterquesting.name: Magic Metal
betterquesting.desc: Infuse some Iron Ingots with magic in a crucible to create Thaumium. Thaumium parts can be used on TiCon tools to create tools that have modifiers without the need for leveling.

betterquesting.name: Jar Jar
betterquesting.desc: Warded Jars can be used to store Essentia. Combining them with an alchemy Golem, and a little effort, will get you an automated storage system for Essentia.

betterquesting.name: Phancy Phials
betterquesting.desc: Warded Jars were too obvious, instead we have Glass Phials for storing small amounts of essentia in.

betterquesting.name: Elevator
betterquesting.desc: Arcane Levitators function much like elevators, only with magic. Place them under your feet and watch as you lift off.

betterquesting.name: Manipulating Foci
betterquesting.desc: Wand Foci can be upgraded. The Jaded One wasn't sure if you knew that. You'll need a Focal Manipulator, some vis, some other components, and a Wand Focus.

betterquesting.name: Wand Charger
betterquesting.desc: Place a Wand Recharge Pedestal down near some Nodes, insert a Wand, and walk away while the Wand Charger transfers the vis from the Nodes into the wand.

betterquesting.name: Relay Race
betterquesting.desc: A Vis Charge Relay can be place over an Arcane Worktable. This allows it to transfer vis from other relays to charge the wands inside the table.

betterquesting.name: Vis Relay
betterquesting.desc: A Vis Relay can transfer vis from a stabilized Node. Once you have stabilized a Node and applied the appropriate components, you can get a steady amount of vis to power your various devices.

betterquesting.name: For whom the bell tolls
betterquesting.desc: The Golem Linking Bell will allow you to link your new minions with different devices for more fine tuned control.

betterquesting.name: Voiding the extra
betterquesting.desc: A Void Jar can get rid of unwanted Essentia. On the other hand, a Brain in a Jar can store experience dropped from mobfarms while you are out wandering.

betterquesting.name: Clearing Flux
betterquesting.desc: The Flux Scrubber can remove the Flux left behind from messy experiments or carelessness. A clean mage is a healthy mage.

betterquesting.name: Bath Time
betterquesting.desc: Scrub a dub dub, scrub the ick off. No really, with some Sanitizing Soap and an Arcane Spa you can get rid of some of the nastier effects of dabbling in the dark arts. At least... temporarily.

betterquesting.name: Infused Stone
betterquesting.desc: Infused Stone can be crafted by following the process laid out in the Agrimancy tab of your Thaumonomicon.

betterquesting.name: Balanced Shards
betterquesting.desc: Aura Shards can be obtained in several ways. You can use an ExNihilo Hammer on various blocks. Grass blocks will give you earth shards. The rest you will need to discover yourself. Alternatively, you can transmute stone into infused stone. The process for that is found in the Agrimancy tab of the Thaumonomicon.

betterquesting.name: Extreme Storage
betterquesting.desc: Using Void Metal, you can create a tank capable of holding 256 Essentia at a time. Much more than a Warded Jar.

betterquesting.name: Treecapitator
betterquesting.desc: The Axe of the Stream can chop entire trees, from the top down, while you are standing on the ground.

betterquesting.name: Magical Mushrooms
betterquesting.desc: No. Not that kind. The vis kind. And their sister the Ethereal Bloom. Both are useful in their own way. The Jaded One recommends reading the epic book by Azanor to find out more.

betterquesting.name: Blazing Vis
betterquesting.desc: Tier Three Wand cores can store up to 75 vis of each type. Each Wand core has an affinity for a specific kind of vis. For example, the Blazing core will slowly restore the ignis vis inside itself up to 10% of the Wand max.

betterquesting.name: Great Staff of Wood
betterquesting.desc: The Greatwood Staff is not only an awesome item for those who feel the need to compensate for their shortcomings, it's also the start of making a magic staff. A Greatwood Staff can hold 125 of each aspect. Different caps will give it different additional abilities.

betterquesting.name: View from a distance
betterquesting.desc: A Crystalline Eye can be used with a Remote Comparator to check the amount of items or fluids in an inventory at a distance, sneak and right click with the eye on the inventory you want to monitor, then place the eye in the comparator. It works like a normal comparator, but remotely.

betterquesting.name: Redstone Vis
betterquesting.desc: A Vis Reader can read how much and what type of vis is available in a container. It can then send out a redstone signal based on the results.

betterquesting.name: Boiler
betterquesting.desc: The Alchemical Boiler can turn fluids into Essentia the same way the Alchemical Furnace processes solids.

betterquesting.name: Minion Power
betterquesting.desc: Remember that old grindstone you abandoned in favor of automated methods? Now that you have minions, perhaps you should train them to automate the grindstone for you. All you need is an Iron Gear Box.

betterquesting.name: Sinful Shards
betterquesting.desc: With some clever work and a bit of luck, you can get new shards. Or, with more work and some resources, you can skip the luck and get the shards you need. Take your pick.

betterquesting.name: Tainted Botany
betterquesting.desc: Have you been dabbling in the dark arts? Are you a messy Thaumaturge? The Tainthistle might be just what you need. It eats taint and turns it into lovely mana for powering more experiments. You will be more careful, right?

betterquesting.name: Dreamy Staff
betterquesting.desc: Dreamwood is one of the best materials for holding vis. While slightly difficult to get, it is well worth the effort.

betterquesting.name: Livingwood Wand
betterquesting.desc: Livingwood makes a useful Wand core. It can draw its energy from storage items in your inventory. However, there are drawbacks.

betterquesting.name: Ethereal Flower
betterquesting.desc: The Euclidaisy has the ability of creating Ethereal Essences without the trouble of battling wisps. It is very sensitive to redstone signals.

betterquesting.name: Pink Cap
betterquesting.desc: Elementium is one of the best materials for capping wands. It will require some research and travel to acquire.

betterquesting.name: Manasteel Capping
betterquesting.desc: Manasteel offers better efficiency than most caps for wands. Especially if the core consumes mana.

betterquesting.name: Node Creation
betterquesting.desc: There are not very many Nodes around here. Luckily, the Jaded One has provided a method by which you can make Nodes. Just attune and place... more or less.

betterquesting.name: Passive Scanning
betterquesting.desc: A Scholar's Lens can be inserted into Goggles of Revealing. While using a Scholar's Lens, the goggles will scan all items you see for their aspects.

betterquesting.name: Infuse Yourself
betterquesting.desc: Want to donate yourself to science? Try injecting yourself with Infused Blood.

betterquesting.name: Biome Changing
betterquesting.desc: Not a fan of the biome you were assigned? Change it with some magic.

betterquesting.name: Upgrade your Clone
betterquesting.desc: Worried about death? Want to come back to a better body? Instead of infusing temporary effects, why not create a clone? And maybe add some upgrades? Like Solar Power? Diamond Skin? Cloaking?

betterquesting.name: Keeping it All
betterquesting.desc: It would be a shame if you lost everything you had on you upon death. Luckily, with a Mirrored Amulet, you don't have to.

betterquesting.name: Old Age
betterquesting.desc: Have some animals you want to grow up faster? Line their pens with Ageing Stone and watch them grow up in a blink.

betterquesting.name: Tallying Storage
betterquesting.desc: A Tally Box and Lenses can be used to keep track of items in an inventory. You can filter what it keeps track of and have it send a redstone signal when the conditions are met.

betterquesting.name: Cloaking Cloth
betterquesting.desc: A Cloak can be more than just a weather protector, it can add inventory space, or make you harder to see - it all depends on the fabric and enchantments used.

betterquesting.name: Magic Cobble
betterquesting.desc: As an alternative to technology, the Thaumic Stone Extruder can be used to make cobble.

betterquesting.name: Ethereal Walls
betterquesting.desc: Walls that appear and disappear with redstone? Walls that can look like anything?

betterquesting.name: Label Printing
betterquesting.desc: Instead of sticking labels on partially filled Warded Jars to mark them, use the Aspect Library to print labels for any aspect you have discovered. Then you can label empty Warded Jars for your filtering system.

betterquesting.name: Essentia Dynamo
betterquesting.desc: Once you have a vis network set up, you'll need to keep it charged. The Essentia Dynamo can charge it using those Warded Jars of useless Essentia lying around.

betterquesting.name: Chameleon
betterquesting.desc: Chameleon tools can store three different sets of enchantments and swap between them.

betterquesting.name: Inventory Tracking
betterquesting.desc: Technology is not the only way to track inventories or to craft items. An Inventarium is a mystical construct that can keep track of multiple inventories and interface with devices.

betterquesting.name: Minion Craftsman
betterquesting.desc: Don't feel like crafting things yourself? Need a steady supply of something craftable? The Golem's Workbench can train your Golems how to craft. Basic Golems can only craft 2x2 recipes. Advanced Golems can craft more complicated recipes.

betterquesting.name: More Crafting
betterquesting.desc: Much like Golems, the workbench can be upgraded. You can add additional recipe slots, multi-purpose recipes, and more.

betterquesting.name: Boost Nutrition
betterquesting.desc: A Ring of Nutrition will multiply the hunger your food can satisfy.

betterquesting.name: NSFW
betterquesting.desc: For the more ... adventurous mage, the Collar of Pain will generate vis every time you take damage. Now you can get vis while adding Life Essence to your Blood Magic Altar.

betterquesting.name: Upgrading Capacity
betterquesting.desc: The Inventarium is limited by the number of slots each bookshelf provides, upgrade regular bookcases with Ensorcelled Bookshelves to multiply the amount of inventory space you have.

betterquesting.name: Scrivener's Oculus
betterquesting.desc: Upgrade to the Scrivener's Oculus to be able to track more than one kind of inventory.

betterquesting.name: Luring Lemmings
betterquesting.desc: The Siren's Lure will convince mobs they want to be near it, they will be so convinced that they won't notice the cliff ...

betterquesting.name: Construct more Pylons
betterquesting.desc: In-air refueling of the Thaumostatic Harness is possible... with some effort.

betterquesting.name: I'm Smeeelting
betterquesting.desc: To start ore processing, and get the most out of your resources, you will need a smeltery. To begin making a smeltery, you will need several stacks of Grout and some lava.

betterquesting.name: Casting
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have a Smeltery, and have read the books (you did read them right?), you can begin casting ingots and tool parts. To make a cast, pour molten Aluminum Brass or Gold over an item placed on the Casting Table. Once you have a cast, you can make copies of that item by pouring molten materials into the cast. If you hold shift while mousing over a cast, it will tell you what materials work in that cast.

betterquesting.name: Iron
betterquesting.desc: Iron is the first tier of tools after Flint that will provide an increase to what you can harvest. "But Jaded, the tool says Stone level!" Yes, yes it does. The way tool leveling works is simple. When you first make a part, it will be one level lower than its maximum level. You will need to level the tool up by using it. If you have already leveled your Flint tool to Iron level, you can skip making iron tools and just proceed to Copper. Just remember, every material starts one level below its max mining Level.

betterquesting.name: Copper
betterquesting.desc: Copper tools start at Copper level, and can be leveled to Bronze-level harvesting.

betterquesting.name: Bronze
betterquesting.desc: Bronze tools start at Bronze level, and can be leveled to Redstone-level harvesting.

betterquesting.name: Redstone
betterquesting.desc: Redstone-level tools start at Redstone and can be leveled to Silver level.

betterquesting.name: Silver
betterquesting.desc: Silver tools start at Silver level and can be leveled to Obsidian level. Silver tools, while not durable, require very little experience to level.

betterquesting.name: Obsidian
betterquesting.desc: Obsidian tools start at Obsidian level and can be leveled to Platinum.

betterquesting.name: Diamond
betterquesting.desc: Diamond level is different. This level lets you mine things you need to make the next level, but you can't make tools out of diamond.

betterquesting.name: Platinum
betterquesting.desc: Platinum tools start at Platinum level and can be leveled to Alumite.

betterquesting.name: Alumite
betterquesting.desc: Alumite tools start at Alumite level and can be leveled to Ardite.

betterquesting.name: Ardite
betterquesting.desc: Ardite-level tools start at ardite and level to Cobalt.

betterquesting.name: Cobalt
betterquesting.desc: Cobalt tools start at Cobalt level and can be leveled to Manyullyn.

betterquesting.name: Steel
betterquesting.desc: Steel tools are between bronze and silver tools in the harvest levels. You can level a bronze tool up and then move to silver without ever making Steel. Or you can make Steel. The choice is up to you. Steel is best made in an induction smelter.

betterquesting.name: Exotic Metals
betterquesting.desc: At various points along the tiers, you can begin making tools out of exotic materials. Enderium, Signalum, Lumium, Plastic, PlasSteel, TerraSteel, and ManaSteel can all be used to make different tool parts. Sometimes, if you craft a tool with one of these exotic metals, you will get a special stat for the tool, like extra modifier slots. Most of these will not apply if you use the material to upgrade an old tool.

betterquesting.name: Purity
betterquesting.desc: Pure Certus Quartz

betterquesting.name: Blank Slate
betterquesting.desc: Blood dipped rock

betterquesting.name: Arcane Crafting
betterquesting.desc: Right click a Thaumcraft Table with a Wand to turn it into an Arcane Worktable. The Arcane Worktable is used to craft many items for Thaumaturgy. It will need a filled Wand in the Wand slot for most recipes.

betterquesting.name: Moo... moo?
betterquesting.desc: Kill Cows

betterquesting.name: Hurmmm
betterquesting.desc: Kill Villagers

betterquesting.name: Cluck, cluck... Chicken Curry?
betterquesting.desc: Kill Chickens

betterquesting.name: Wetty Squiddy
betterquesting.desc: Kill Squids

betterquesting.name: Nitro Hiss
betterquesting.desc: Kill Nitro Creepers

betterquesting.name: Hot Spiders
betterquesting.desc: Kill Heatscar Spiders

betterquesting.name: Hot... Bats?
betterquesting.desc: Kill Firebat

betterquesting.name: Special Delivery
betterquesting.desc: The Floral One has expensive taste. A bit of Pixie Dust and some Dragonstones go a long way to appease her hunger. For now, she just wants you to learn how to contact the elves of Alfheim, and learn how to trade with them.

betterquesting.name: Blazing Basalz
betterquesting.desc: Kill Basalz

betterquesting.name: Power Hungry Platter
betterquesting.desc:
Emeralds aren't the only lovely green resource in our world. The Floral One created an amazing material by elegantly smashing mana infused materials together with massive amounts of Mana.

Place a spark over the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate (TAP). Place a second spark over the Mana Pool. Make sure the Mana Pool is over half-filled. Then place the necessary materials onto the TAP.

betterquesting.name: The Power of Lava
betterquesting.desc: You've heard of lava generators. I know you have. Well, this generator created by the Floral One generates large amounts of Mana by consuming lava. But be careful not to overfeed. Or the lava just goes to waste.

betterquesting.name: Short Circuit
betterquesting.desc: Sparks will pass massive amounts of Mana without harm to themselves or others. They act like a short circuit from the Mana source to the Mana destination. Use them to feed a Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate. Just know that their range is rather limited.

betterquesting.name: Stop and Smell The Rose
betterquesting.desc: If only there was a way to convert XP into Mana.... The Rosa Arcana does just that. As you pass within one block, your XP will feed the rose.

betterquesting.name: Fire Power
betterquesting.desc:
Endoflames produce Mana from any combustible materials within a three-block radius. They are very easy to automate. A fine addition to the power flower family.

Unlike their cousin, the Hydroangeas, they will never die off.

betterquesting.name: Altared States
betterquesting.desc: The Runic Altar, sadly, serves only one purpose. It turns common items into Runes with a bit of time, Mana and a catalyst. But it does it well. And quickly, with the right upgrades. (Hint: Alfheim Portal.)

betterquesting.name: 'Tis the Season
betterquesting.desc: Flowers, being seasonal, sometimes need a little help. Make these Runes to grow a greater variety of flowers.

betterquesting.name: The Seven...
betterquesting.desc: These Sinful Runes will help your garden grow even more. The flowers from these Runes cause all kinds of useful mayhem!

betterquesting.name: Pick It Up, Put It Down
betterquesting.desc: The Rannuncarpus will pick up any nearby dropped block item and place it in the world nearby. But, it only places the block item thrown at it on top of a specific block. To specify the block, place it below the soil that the Rannuncarpus flower is resting on. The only limitation is that the block that the block item will be placed on must meet the placement requirements, like Sugarcane on Dirt or Sand next to water. No Mana needed. However, Mana increases its range.

betterquesting.name: It's A Trap!
betterquesting.desc: The Tangleberrie forms an invisible fence that will keep any nearby Mobs, benign or hostile, within its confines. Only a small amount of Mana is used to keep this flower happily warding away.

betterquesting.name: Mighty Morphin'
betterquesting.desc: Stone blocks transform into eight different Metamorphic Stone when exposed to this little number, with the help of Mana. Why not make a colorful Petal Apothecary? There are eight options. The Dreamer has a fondness for the Forest.

betterquesting.name: Protect Me!
betterquesting.desc: Sweet Jiyuulia will protect any player within its range. Feed it Mana and it will keep any nearby Mobs at bay!

betterquesting.name: Medusa's Favorite Flower
betterquesting.desc: Medusa has many Medumone in her surrounding gardens, along with all the statues. Medumone will stop all creatures in their tracks. Lucky for you, Minion, it doesn't affect players. Just make sure Mana is nearby for Medumone to actually work.

betterquesting.name: Clay Me A Song
betterquesting.desc: Tune up this little flower and it will moisten Sand with some Mana, turning it into Clay.

betterquesting.name: Growing A Mystical Garden
betterquesting.desc: Mystical madness! Simply feed the Jaded Amaranthus with generous dollops of Mana and watch your mystical garden grow! No more need for Floral Fertilizer to replenish your stock of mystical beauties.

betterquesting.name: Floral Fields are Not Food
betterquesting.desc: Fill your fields with flowers as far as the eye can see. Or not. Use Floral Fertilizer on Dirt or Grass blocks. Each Floral Fertilizer will sprout three or four random Mystical Flowers.

betterquesting.name: Let Them Eat Cake
betterquesting.desc: Another flowery glutton that generates Mana is Kekimurus. Place a cake near this showy little flower and it will consume it one bite at a time.

betterquesting.name: Sippin' Slimes Makes Mana!
betterquesting.desc: Those slimey cubes showed up in droves! What are you going to do? Well, you can slaughter them or, better yet, use them to generate more Mana! Plant this pretty in a Slime Chunk and it will feed on slimes. The bigger the slime, the greater the Mana generation.

betterquesting.name: Wooly Rainbow
betterquesting.desc: Feed Spectrolus Wool. ALL the colors of Wool. In the same order as NEI. If you lose track of which one is next, look at it while holding the Wand of the Forest. When the wool is consumed, Spectrolus generates 300 Mana per color.

betterquesting.name: Violet Cannibal
betterquesting.desc: In short, Rafflowsia consumes any CRAFTABLE Botania flowers within a 11x11x11 area. Good way to get rid of extras that you no longer need. Don't feed it the same flower sequentially or its Mana production suffers greatly.

betterquesting.name: Energizing Fuel
betterquesting.desc: Mana beats Coal! Place this hot little number near Furnaces. The Exoflame will fuel and boost their processing speed.

betterquesting.name: Battle Gaia and Its Minions
betterquesting.desc: Battling Gaia is easier using many of the flowers you've made. Concentrate on bringing down Gaia. Regen with Fallen Kanade. Trap and immobilize the mobs with Medumone and Tangleberrie; repel them with Jiyuulia. Use Hyacidus and Bellethorne to poison and harm them, Tigerseye to stop the creepers from blowing up, and Vinculotus to keep Endermen from teleporting from the battlefield. Especially, use Heisei Dream to turn the mobs against each other.

betterquesting.name: Game of Life
betterquesting.desc: This flower plays Conway's Game of Life, generating massive amounts of Mana. The field size, however, makes this a daunting method for Mana generation. If you want to try using the Dandelifeon, read the rules and setup in the Lexica Botania.

betterquesting.name: I'm No Angel
betterquesting.desc: The Angelic Fallen Kanade applies a regeneration effect to any nearby players when provided with Mana.

betterquesting.name: Thorny Belles
betterquesting.desc: By utilizing Mana, the Thorne Sisters slowly inflicts harm on any living mobs around it. Bellethorn is indiscriminate and Dreadthorne attacks only adult entities.

betterquesting.name: I've Got My Eye On You
betterquesting.desc: Creepers tremble in the presence of cats. Cats scare the boom right out of them! Creepers can't tell the difference between a Cat and a Tigerseye. Use this to your advantage.

betterquesting.name: Gettin' Loud
betterquesting.desc: Pasture Seeds are useful for fertilizing dirt to grow grass. Use them also to make a few horns. Horn of the Wild is perfect to harvest an entire farm. Adding a Leaf Block to the horn will allow you to blast away the leaves from your trees. Alternatively, adding a Snowball will allow you to blow away the snow.

betterquesting.name: Buuurrrrrppp!!!
betterquesting.desc: This gluttonous flower will burp Mana after eating any food dropped nearby. Better foods will encourage this flower to release more Mana. Be aware the Gourmaryllis won't vent Mana until it burns through the meal. Nutritional value of a food determines the time it takes for this flower to be ready for its next meal. So don't feed it during digestion or the food gets consumed without producing more Mana. Also, this gourmand prefers variety to keep producing copious amounts of Mana.

betterquesting.name: What a Blast!
betterquesting.desc: This flower loves Creepers when they go boom. Don't want Creepers boomin? Use TNT instead. The blast from TNT generates a blast of Mana. The Entropinnyum won't absorb another blast, though, until the stored Mana is depleted.

betterquesting.name: Eat Yer Greens!
betterquesting.desc: Plant this hungry little number where trees grow. A Munchdew will consume all available leaves within its reach and pour out plenty of Mana. Once done though, it won't eat again for a minute or more.

betterquesting.name: I'm not Attracted to You
betterquesting.desc: You've automated systems that drop block items. If you're wearing a Ring of Magnetization, Solegnolia disables the magnetic field from picking them up. It does not require Mana to function.

betterquesting.name: Green Thumb
betterquesting.desc: Fertilize your crops using the Mana-powered Agricarnation.

betterquesting.name: Purple Poison
betterquesting.desc: Hyacidus poisons nearby mobs, bringing them to a half heart, making it easy to wipe them out with one hit. Players are not affected.

betterquesting.name: Population Explosion
betterquesting.desc: Pollidisiac will feed dropped foods to animals, getting them into a loving mood. Good way to repopulate your fields without getting your hand bitten off...

betterquesting.name: Ender-Man.A Tether
betterquesting.desc: When an Enderman tries to teleport away, the Vinculotus draws the Enderman to it, making it easy for you to dispatch these dark strangers.

betterquesting.name: Hazy Dream
betterquesting.desc: With a bit of Mana, the Heisei Dream flower will confuse and enrage your enemies into attacking each other.

betterquesting.name: Treasure Hunter
betterquesting.desc: You can become a treasure hunter without leaving the comfort of your island in the sky. But, Loonium uses LOTS of Mana and ... you don't want to know...

betterquesting.name: Item Teleportation
betterquesting.desc: Spectranthem, when linked to an inventory with the Wand of The Forest in Bind Mode, will teleport items around it to that inventory. Must be within 12 blocks of the inventory block. Mob farm drops cleanup maybe?

betterquesting.name: Player Transporter
betterquesting.desc: Using Luminizers, you can transport to different locations. Space Luminizers up to 20 blocks apart and use them to move quickly from one location to another. The only issue is multiple "transporters" can be linked to a single "receiver", but each "transporter" can target only one other. To activate a Luminizer, simply right click it. Ultimate benefit, you can pass through solid objects. However, you may experience a little damage. When in a closed loop, hold shift to escape.

betterquesting.name: Don't Breathe
betterquesting.desc: If you haven't already done so, go to the End and collect Ender Air. Ender Air isn't necessarily toxic but don't take chances by trying to drink it. You can, however, throw the bottle to the ground to convert common Stone into End Stone.

betterquesting.name: Mana To RF
betterquesting.desc: The Mana Fluxfield converts Mana to RF quite efficiently. In another life, The Dreamer powered an entire Genetics laboratory with a single Mana Fluxfield and RF storage device.

betterquesting.name: Transformation
betterquesting.desc: You finally found a couple blazes to whack! Make this Alchemy Catalyst to transform common items into other common items. It's a good way to get extra leather when breeding and killing cows is too dangerous.

betterquesting.name: I'm Seeing Double
betterquesting.desc: This cool little cube will double some resources using Mana. F'rinstance, throw in a coal to receive two in return. Other useful resources that will double include Redstone, Glowstone and Nether Quartz. Multiply all your Rewards!

betterquesting.name: Elusive Treasures
betterquesting.desc: Among the treasures you've gleaned using the Loonium, you may have come across these two items. The Overgrowth Seed transforms a Grass Block into Enchanted Soil that will keep Dayblooms, Nightshade or Hydroangeas from fracturing after their third day of life. The Black Lotus is pure mana in solid form. Once there is Mana in the Mana Pool, throw in the Black Lotus for a burst of Mana. Its cousin, the Blacker Lotus, provides an even larger charge of Mana.

betterquesting.name: Where Do Baby Villagers Come From?
betterquesting.desc: In this world, the answer to this question is the Cocoon of Caprice. Normally, the cocoon will randomly hatch animals. But The Dreamer wants Villagers. Place the cocoons and feed them Emeralds until they stop accepting them (about 20). When the cocoons split open, you should have baby villagers. With this pair, you can now begin a Villager breeding program.

betterquesting.name: Greener Pastures
betterquesting.desc: Pasture Seeds come in several flavors. For now, gather tall Grass and throw them into the Mana Pool.

betterquesting.name: Percussive Power
betterquesting.desc: Transform the Horn of the Wild into a Drum of the Wild. Also, convert the Horn of the Canopy to the Drum of the Canopy. The drums, when hit with a burst of Mana (like from a Pulse Mana Spreader,) will perform as they did when they were handheld horns.

betterquesting.name: The Gathering
betterquesting.desc: Drum of The Gathering will shear sheep and milk cows when a pulse of Mana hits it. Make sure buckets are below the cows to collect the milk.

betterquesting.name: More Pretty Pink Please!
betterquesting.desc: Now that you understand the basics of trading with the elves of Alfheim, trade for more of the pretty pink stuffs.

betterquesting.name: Paving the Way
betterquesting.desc: Portuguese Pavement is rarely looked at as a decorative alternative to cobblestone building materials. However, the recipes are perfect for early-game structure building and are a delicious change from drab grays. So get to expanding and building with Portuguese Pavement today!

betterquesting.name: Tuba or Not Tuba
betterquesting.desc: The Dreamer reminisces about playing French Horn in Her youth. She wants to hear the sweet notes pour forth in your world. Craft the Cacophonium and right-click any mob to learn its sound. Then let it peal to the heavens! Better yet! Shift-right-click a Note Block and let the sounds be heard by all.

betterquesting.name: Spare the Rod...
betterquesting.desc:
Although your world is a Void, you must craft these Rods to aid you in your quests. Some may appear useless here but build them and research their uses. A quick synopsis is below. All require Mana to use. Hint: Rod of the Lands makes dirt.

Rod of the Plentiful Mantle: Find ores.
Rod of the Depths: Place Cobblestone block.
Rod of the Skies: Propels player 33 blocks into the air. Negates fall damage as long as there's Mana.
Rod of the Seas: Place Water source blocks. Also fills the Petal Apothecary.
Rod of the Hells: Ring of fire for 15 seconds. Player and mobs catch fire and take damage.
Rod of the Molten Core: Smelts targeted blocks.

betterquesting.name: I Can See Clearly Now
betterquesting.desc: Managlass is a versatile, virtually invisible, alternative to regular Glass. Simply throw Glass into the Mana Pool. For the fun of it, fill any gaps in your floor. Then the Void won't call to you so strongly. As for the Managlass Vials, soon you will need them.

betterquesting.name: Obey Me!
betterquesting.desc: Flowers are fickle. They remain focused at the point where they were last bound. A quick way to change all of them is to use the Flora Obediance Stick; shift-right-click the receiving block and all relevant flowers will link to it.

betterquesting.name: Stick Shift Rod
betterquesting.desc: Rod of the Shifting Crust is a swapping wand on Mana (no steroids here...) To use it, choose a block with shift-right-click, then right-click will replace them en masse or left-click to individually replace a block.

betterquesting.name: More (or less) Useful Rods
betterquesting.desc:
The Rod of The Shaded Mesa is a general purpose grabbing tool. Hold right-click to capture a mob or item, release to drop it. Dragging the mouse with a captured entity will move it. While holding left-click, right-clicking will throw it in the direction of the cursor. There's no delay between uses. Using it on other players makes them experience severe nausea effects.

Rod of the Highlands allows placing dirt in midair.

Rod of the Bifrost will extend a bridge out 100 blocks and lasts for 15 seconds.

betterquesting.name: Singular Resurrection
betterquesting.desc: Resolute Ivy will cling to items in a player's inventory, ensuring they are bound to the player until resurrected. A good way to ensure you don't lose your precious Mana-infused armor, tools, and weapons. After you're resurrected, the ivy dies and must be reapplied. It's worth it!

betterquesting.name: Permafrost
betterquesting.desc: The Bifrost Bridge is just too ephemeral to add ethereal elements to your Home in the Sky. Make these beautiful Bifrost Blocks to capture the essence of Bifrost in a more permanent form.

betterquesting.name: I've Got The Blues
betterquesting.desc: Armor made with Manasteel. Huh. It's pretty, I think. It's definitely better than bare skin, especially since it is self-repairing as long as it has access to Mana. There are some exceptionally useful tools too!

betterquesting.name: Do You Have The Time?
betterquesting.desc: Easily one of the best early-game tools in Botania is the Hovering Hourglass. It acts as a timer and can be programmed. Adding Sand applies one second per block, Red Sand applies ten seconds per block, and Soul Sand applies one minute per block. Prepare the "stacks" with the amount of time you desire (The Dreamer uses six blocks of Soul Sand to control feeding a Thermalily with Lava.) Right-click the hourglass to add/remove the stack. Right-click with a Wand of the Forest to lock/unlock the hourglass; read the status of the hourglass.

betterquesting.name: Ghost Writer
betterquesting.desc: Phantom Ink applies Invisibility to your Mana-blue armor. Only you will know you are wearing it. And it retains all of its protective qualities.

betterquesting.name: Gettin' Sash-y
betterquesting.desc:
Get yer Soujourner's Sash on and travel around. Sashes are a very useful way to ease the travails of travel. This waist-ful beauty will pick your petard up one block, and allows you to "jump" over one-block gaps, without the jump of course! Just move forward and let the sash do the work, for a small bit of Mana.

Upgrade this sash to a Planestrider's Sash with a bit of sugar, a couple pasture seeds, and a used map. You'll lose the initial speed boost but start walking and speed builds up with each step. Once stopped, though, the speed gain resets.

betterquesting.name: Color Me Blue
betterquesting.desc:
Blue is not a state of mind here. Instead, the power of Mana infuses items when they are dropped into the Mana Pool. With that in mind, make a bunch of Mana-infused materials...

Hint: Use any Floral Powder to make Mana Powder.

betterquesting.name: The Root of Power
betterquesting.desc: Some of the lovely flowers use Redstone Root. This root allows you to control them with a redstone signal.

betterquesting.name: Drink Me!
betterquesting.desc: Drink up and experience the wonderful effects.

betterquesting.name: Drink Me More!
betterquesting.desc: Drink up and experience the wonderful effects. Extra doses. So worth it!

betterquesting.name: Fetch!
betterquesting.desc: The Corporea Network has only one function: Retrieval. But it does it with ease. Read the Botania Lexica for in-depth instructions to set it up for use. The Dreamer loves all the pretty sparks.

betterquesting.name: Incensed!
betterquesting.desc:
Mmmm! Lovely aromas. I feel so good!...

Light up these sticks and experience the effects of the smoke for as long as it takes for the incense to burn.

betterquesting.name: There's Lots of Space in Here
betterquesting.desc: The Black Hole Talisman is portable storage for massive amounts of a single item-type. A fine way to store ALL of stacks of decorative stone you want to use to expand your world. Place down one block and right click to set the filter for the talisman. Shift-right-click in air to enable/disable; right click an inventory to fill the talisman with the matching item. Place in a crafting grid to retrieve a stack of the item. Right click where you are building to place blocks as if from a stack. Works with the Rod of the Shifting Crust, so no more filling your personal inventory with blocks.

betterquesting.name: Weaver's Delight
betterquesting.desc: Throw lots of string, a couple stacks will do, into the Mana Pool. Use the result to craft Manaweave Cloth and then craft a full set of Manaweave Apparel. Both stylish and will grant some awesome Mana-wise bonuses when worn. Self-repairing too!

betterquesting.name: Halo There!
betterquesting.desc:
Portable crafting table with 11 additional slots for recipes. While holding it, right click to open the halo. Craft your recipe in the crafting slot. Then move your cursor to an empty slot and right click to save that recipe. To use the saved recipe, as long as you have the resources in your personal inventory, right click to instantly craft it. Great for compressing all that cobble you collect while mining. To clear a recipe, shift left click the slot. 

Add a Mana Diamond to the Assembly Halo to convert it into a Manufactory Halo. Now, as long as the resources are available, the halo will automatically craft on the fly. Like multi-compressing Cobblestone and Dirt blocks.

betterquesting.name: Mobile Mana
betterquesting.desc: There will come a time when you will need portable Mana. This tablet meets that need. Craft it and drop it into a filled Mana Pool. As long as it has Mana, your Mana-infused equipment will all be self-repairing. Much less annoying than repairing with anvils.

betterquesting.name: Bandy About
betterquesting.desc: A Band of Mana is an even better way to carry Mana on the go. This sweet little bauble can rest in your baubles slot. Or just carry it after filling it.

betterquesting.name: Bandy About for Free Mana!
betterquesting.desc: A Band of Aura makes Mana. Carry a Mana Tablet or a Ring of Mana and it will slowly fill with Mana from the Band of Aura.

betterquesting.name: Greater Bands Greater Rewards
betterquesting.desc: Add Terrasteel to the Bands and Rings to make them even greater!

betterquesting.name: Terra Team
betterquesting.desc:
Make the armor and tools with Terrasteel. Like their Manasteel counterparts, Mana will keep them repaired. 

The Terra Blade will shoot Mana from its tip to harm mobs from a distance.

The Thorn Chakram will always return to the caster. Make a few of these for a continuous supply of a rather formidable throwing weapon.

betterquesting.name: Not Really Here
betterquesting.desc: Strange block am I. Place me and jump on. Only my upper surface has fragile substance. Try to crouch and you will fall through. At eye and knee level, you may walk through as if I don't even exist. But I'm perfect for filling gaps. Or stopping the rain.

betterquesting.name: Delft Design in Da House
betterquesting.desc: The Azulejos are beautiful blocks for adding to your builds. Build a palace fit for The Dreamer and her gang of ephemerals to reside within. Or just use them in your own builds. There are 16 patterns to choose from. Try them all.

betterquesting.name: Cosmetic Carrier
betterquesting.desc: All those Botanic baubles take up so many inventory slots! Woof! What a pain! Ah, but we have a solution! Make this handy dandy Bauble Case and you can carry all your baubles with ease and swap them out even while away from home.

betterquesting.name: I am a Planet!
betterquesting.desc: Tiny Planet draws Mana bursts to you, proving to the world that Mana revolves around you. If you prefer, surround the planet with stone and place it down. It will draw mana bursts to it, like a moth to flames. Truly a sad waste but pretty to watch.

betterquesting.name: Love, Forever
betterquesting.desc: Tiny Potato is such a sweet little entity. Right click any face with an item and it will love you and hold the item forever. Right click again to retrieve your items. Tiny will still love you. Tiny doesn't always know how to hold an item so some may stick out in *ahem* strange ways.

betterquesting.name: Such a Diva!
betterquesting.desc: Charm of the Diva makes you irresistible to mobs, after you attack them. Such masochists! But, they will follow you, adore you and attack any other enemies near you. The charm does require Mana to function though. So if you run out of mana...

betterquesting.name: Fashion Statement?
betterquesting.desc:
The cloaks require a 10 second recharge period between activations but are powerful while active.

The Cloak of Virtue blocks the full extent of damage taken.

The Cloak of Sin shares damage dealt by the mob, dealing equal damage to the mob.

betterquesting.name: Crafty Crafting
betterquesting.desc: The Crafty Crate is quite versatile when used for automation. When used in conjunction with a dispenser or the Open Crate, automation is easily achieved. There are even preset patterns that will assign which slots are placeholders versus accepting items for crafting. Read the entry in the Lexica Botania for the full extent of this powerful little crafter.

betterquesting.name: The Callers
betterquesting.desc:
Starcaller - There's a chance, when attacking a mob, that stars will be summoned. The mobs will never know what hit them. The stars can be called from afar.

Thundercaller - Chain lightning. Pretty awesome to watch as it forks to deal damage to all other mobs. One mob must be attacked to activate the chain.

betterquesting.name: Pyroclastic Extinctor
betterquesting.desc: While worn, flames will be extinguished rather than burning you extensively. Does not stop damage inflicted while you are a torch.

betterquesting.name: Prima Pyroclastic Extinctor
betterquesting.desc: Improve the Pyroclastic Pendant with a Gaia Spirit and some other fiery components not only to extinguish the flames but to grant you immunity to fire and lava damage.

betterquesting.name: No Arrows Needed
betterquesting.desc: The Crystal Bow fires arrows of Mana, at greater velocity than a wooden bow.

betterquesting.name: Roses Are Red, This String is Too.
betterquesting.desc: Tied together with a block of Redstone, a bottled breath of Ender Air and a bit of Pixie Dust, Red String is a powerful item.

betterquesting.name: Red String Automation
betterquesting.desc: Using Red String blocks will allow you a great deal of freedom in automation. The Dreamer has only dreamed of using them so you must do the research yourself on the many uses of these amazing blocks.

betterquesting.name: Elemental!
betterquesting.desc: Like Manasteel and Terrasteel, Elementium armor and tools use Mana to maintain their good looks. The bonuses are greater as well. Well worth the wait to make these prime materials.

betterquesting.name: Forcing Around
betterquesting.desc:
Dear Diary,

Today I accidently dropped a Piston in a Mana Pool. Much to my surprise, it turned into ... something. A Force Relay. I experimented with it, trying different things. Since most of my experiments involved binding different things with the Wand of the Forest, I tested by binding the relay to a block. Nothing happened until I pushed the Force Relay with a Piston and, much to my surprise, when the relay was moved by the Piston, the block I bound to the relay moved! I wonder what would happen if I used it with Mana Spreaders and various Mana Lenses...

betterquesting.name: Floaters
betterquesting.desc:
Any Botania flower, mystical, functional or generating. 

First, make a Glimmering White Flower by coating it with two Glowstone Dust. To turn the flower into a floater, combine the new flower with a Pasture Seed and a Dirt block.

These lovelies cast light, more light than torches! But their best feature is when you combine a floating flower (any color works for this...) with the functional or generating flowers. Imagine the possibilities!

Added bonus: The floating flowers cannot be washed away by flowing liquids.

betterquesting.name: With Flare
betterquesting.desc: Add a bit of Blaze Powder and Pixie dust to a couple of Thorn Chakram. Now you have FLARE! Toss a few at mobs and enjoy the show.

betterquesting.name: Forever
betterquesting.desc:
Do you have a favorite tool, or armor, that you put away because it's too expensive to repair? Well, if you must use them, you can add Timeless Ivy plus three of the repair materials to the item so it can be repaired with Mana.

Timeless Ivy uses more Mana for non-Mana-infused tools and armor, and no bonuses are granted.

betterquesting.name: Walking The Path
betterquesting.desc: Like tilled farmland, this block is inset a tiny bit into the ground. When using the path made with these blocks, there is a slight boost to walking speed.

betterquesting.name: Signal Corps?
betterquesting.desc:
A bit of a light show... mostly. Unstable Cubes simply put on a nice lightning display. But, when four of them are combined with a Mana Pearl, they become an Unstable Beacon. Unlike their namesake, this beacon shoots a beam of colored orbs into the sky that scatter in a spray. 

Wrap an Unstable Beacon in Livingwood and an Iron Ingot and now you have a Signal Flare. Like the Unstable Beacon, same light show, but with the added benefit of stunning mobs for a few seconds.

betterquesting.name: Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star
betterquesting.desc: The Starfield Creator fills the sky above with twinkling stars. That's all it does. But it does it quite well and doesn't require Mana to work.

betterquesting.name: Bottled Slime
betterquesting.desc: When you carry me into a chunk that spawns Slimes, I bounce around in excitement.

Mana Lenses increase the versatility of the Mana Spreaders. The basic Mana Lens is simply a blank for building all the other lenses. 

These first six lenses are easily crafted with a combination of mundane items and mana-infused items.

Once crafted, Mana Lenses can be combined with a Slime Ball to apply the effects from both. Only the first lens affects the appearance and texture of the Mana pulse. Some combinations cannot be crafted. Read the passage in the Lexica Botania for all of the lenses and their effects.

betterquesting.name: Tis The Seasons
betterquesting.desc: These lenses focus the power of the seasons.

betterquesting.name: Elementals of the Lens
betterquesting.desc: These Mana Lenses focus the power of the elements.

betterquesting.name: Deadly Entropic Damage (DED!)
betterquesting.desc: These lenses harness the fury of two of the seven deadlies.

betterquesting.name: Party Time
betterquesting.desc: These lenses harness the frivolous fun of the fairy folk of Alfheim. I'm sure there are other uses but the effects are pretty captivating.

betterquesting.name: Sundancer
betterquesting.desc: Teru Teru Bozu loves the sun. When placed in world, it will decrease the time of inclement weather. If that isn't enough, throw Sunflowers at it and it will bring back the sun.

betterquesting.name: Insubstantial
betterquesting.desc:
The Spectral Platform has absolutely no substance. All things (except rain it seems) pass through as if it doesn't exist. Although mobs can pass through, they treat it as a solid object, unless bumped through by their herdmates.

A better use is to build a railway using Spectral Rails to pass through walls. Excellent way to manage collection and delivery of Mana by rail without leaving the safety of your fortress.

betterquesting.name: Spread The Love
betterquesting.desc: What's not to love about a turntable? Build this rotator and place it under a Mana Spreader (or place a Mana Spreader on it.)

betterquesting.name: Calm Down, Terra!
betterquesting.desc: The Stone of Temperance keeps the Terra Shatterer and the Terra Truncator from wrecking your world. It dampens the impact to a 3x3 area of effect. Toggle with shift-right-click.

betterquesting.name: Eye See You!
betterquesting.desc:
Place me in world, top with a Redstone Lamp. Now look at me, look away, look at me.

If anyone looks at me within a 64 block radius, I will light up. The Redstone Lamp just makes me happy.

betterquesting.name: Hot Fel-low
betterquesting.desc: Place me on top of two Iron Bars stacked one atop the other. I become a Blaze. When you shatter me though, I will only drop Blaze Powder.

betterquesting.name: The Spectator
betterquesting.desc: Wear in the headband slot. While worn, any held item will glow in world, whether in inventory or dropped, including Villager trades and other players. Way cool helper!

betterquesting.name: Slinger
betterquesting.desc: This slinger has one purpose in life - to slingshot Vine Balls, allowing them to ignore gravity.

betterquesting.name: Mana Flow?
betterquesting.desc:
Sometimes, when using tools to see where Mana should flow, it's hard to tell if it is actually flowing. Place this block between a Mana source and a Mana target; it will pulse a redstone signal each time a Mana burst passes through it. 

Hmmm, I detect some possible automation options here.

betterquesting.name: Nature's Ladder
betterquesting.desc:
Normally, Vines can only be climbed when they are in full contact with a solid block behind them. With this sticky little glob, you can free climb. Throw at a block and they grow instantly. Give it a try. I dare you!

(Hint: You can get your first Vines by growing a 2x2 Jungle Tree.)

betterquesting.name: ManaRail
betterquesting.desc:
This is a nifty way to move Mana in your sprawling setups.

When used with a Manatide Bellows (be patient, you'll be able to make it soon), the Mana can be delivered quickly to and from Mana Pools.

betterquesting.name: Mana Void? Noooooo!!! But...
betterquesting.desc:
It seems counter to the pursuit of Mana but sometimes it is unaVOIDable. Especially useful for automation that detects Mana bursts but no real need for the Mana itself.

From the Lexica Botania:

"The Mana Void is, in layman's terms, the grave for Mana. Any Mana shot into this block will simply vanish into the void, never to be seen again.
Placing one of these under a Mana Pool allows the pool to always accept Mana, but disposing any it can't hold."

betterquesting.name: Mana Star
betterquesting.desc: The Manastar makes pretty particles when Mana is flowing - to or from the Mana Pool. When gaining or losing Mana, the Manastar will emit red or blue particles, respectively.

betterquesting.name: Vertical Descent
betterquesting.desc: Droppers are the best way to drop items but they don't always drop straight down. With an Open Crate, any items will always drop vertically to the block below it. Lends itself exceptionally well to any automation that requires precision drops.

betterquesting.name: Counting Sheep
betterquesting.desc: Actually, counting animals. When two or more animals are within detectable range, the Eye of the Ancients will emit a redstone signal strength appropriate to the total number of animals, up to 16 animals. Great way to auto-trigger some form of rancher to keep population density at a manageable level.

betterquesting.name: Handy!
betterquesting.desc: This thieving helpmeet may not be allowed on servers. In its most benign form, it is a portable Ender Chest.

betterquesting.name: Little Helper
betterquesting.desc: Livingwood Avatars are strange little helpers. By themselves, they're nothing more than a way to have a cute carving hold some of your Botania rods. However, feed it with a Mana Spreader and, if it can, it will actually use the Rod.

betterquesting.name: Better Bow
betterquesting.desc: Like a conventional Bow but lasts longer. With Mana available, it is self-repairing.

betterquesting.name: Pylon Power
betterquesting.desc:
These Mana Pylons have the unique ability to power Enchantment Tables. Two pylons to replace all the bookshelves? Aw, yeah!

Better yet, use four Mana Pylons and build the Mana Enchanter. For the price of Mana, the Mana Enchanter will enchant items without consuming the books from which it extracts the enchantments. It's worth a read and a setup. This is how The Dreamer likes to enchant new armor and tools.

Read the Lexica Botania for setting up the Mana Enchanter.

betterquesting.name: Range Finder
betterquesting.desc: The Manaseer Monocle makes visible all Mana-related connections. It is also a range finder of sorts. Look at any flower and a field of effect will become visible. Even better, shift-right-click the flower with a Wand of the Forest and it will keep the field visible. Makes it much easier to troubleshoot when an unexpected problem arises when automating.

betterquesting.name: The Right Tool
betterquesting.desc: It's annoying when the wrong tool is in hand for a task. Wear the Ring of Correction and you will always use the correct tool. Of course, this means you have to have the tool in your inventory somewhere for it to work.

betterquesting.name: Ender Butter?
betterquesting.desc: Nah. No such thing. But this sweet little blade will slice through an Enderman as if it was butter. Only good for a few kills before it breaks. Well worth the cost in materials.

betterquesting.name: Clearly!
betterquesting.desc: As clear as the material it can harvest, the Vitreous Pickaxe will save you the hassle of making more glass every time you need to remove misplaced blocks. Yes, like silk touch but only for glass.

betterquesting.name: Perfect Circles
betterquesting.desc:
Ghostly images appear as perfect circles of cobblestone. Building guide. Nothing more. Well worth the price, if you're into that sort of thing.

Read the Lexica Botania for further instructions.

betterquesting.name: Have Mana, Will Travel
betterquesting.desc: Become a master with this Mana Blaster. Shoot beams of Mana toward target blocks as if using a Mana Spreader. Craft with various lenses. Lenses can be swapped.

betterquesting.name: Knock Knock
betterquesting.desc:
Who's there? 

The Tectonic Girdle negates knockback. A really good thing to be wearing when living on the edge.

betterquesting.name: Swimming With the Fishes
betterquesting.desc: The Ring of Chordata allows one to move faster, see better and stay underwater longer.

betterquesting.name: Dis-Mantle
betterquesting.desc: Ring of the Mantle allows the wearer to dig faster. There's a small speed bonus as well when engaging enemies.

betterquesting.name: Mirror, Mirror
betterquesting.desc: Like a Mana Tablet. But, unlike the tablet, it cannot be filled or drained. It only requires being linked to a Mana Pool to provide Mana to items in a player's inventory.

betterquesting.name: You Bellowed?
betterquesting.desc:
The Manatide Bellows speed the transfer of Mana into tablets and other Mana-bearing items. Point it towards to pool for it to work.

Oddly, the bellows still actually work like bellows when used with a Furnace. Place it next to and point it toward the furnace and manually work the bellows to increase the speed and efficiency of the Furnace. Maybe there's a machine that can do the work of the player?

betterquesting.name: Frozen
betterquesting.desc: Ever wanted to walk on water? Wear the Snowflake Pendant and water will freeze as you step and thaw after you pass. Need to actually be IN the water? Sneak until it melts.

betterquesting.name: Reaching Out
betterquesting.desc: The Ring of Far Reach increases the player's reach by three blocks. Cuts down on the need for bridging gaps to reach that one special ore.

betterquesting.name: In Case of Emergency
betterquesting.desc: The World Seed is a must-have for the intrepid explorer, or even just to get home quick from across the vast expanse that you've made of your niche in the sky. If you're more than 24 blocks away from spawn, right-clicking with it will instantly return you. Well, maybe it's not a must-have for a server world.

betterquesting.name: Disappearing Act
betterquesting.desc: No matter how hard you try, you will never be able to fill this bucket. It all just evaporates into nothingness.

betterquesting.name: Pixie Potential
betterquesting.desc: Wear this ring and, if you're hit, there's a chance a pixie will spawn. Pretty painful, eh? Especially for the one who hit you.

betterquesting.name: Accessorize
betterquesting.desc: Swapping lenses on the Mana Blaster gets old. One way to consolidate the lenses is with the lens clip. Just attach it the the blaster, and now you can switch out lenses as needed. Stores up to six lenses.

betterquesting.name: Life Finds a Way
betterquesting.desc: The Life Imbuer pretends to be a nearby player when placed on top of a Monster Spawner. Now, even when you have to be across your island, the spawner is still spilling mobs into the world for you. Great way to automate vanilla spawners! Make sure a Mana Pool with a Mana Spreader pointing at the Life Imbuer to power it.

betterquesting.name: One-Click Switch
betterquesting.desc:
Mana Lenses are exceptionally useful for changing the properties of the Mana bursts. But changing the lenses requires removing the old one to place the new one. The Mana Prism allows the lenses to be swapped with a single click.

By its very nature, the Mana Prism is spectral, allowing entities and bursts to travel through it but still applying the effect of the installed lenses.

betterquesting.name: Augmenting the Spark
betterquesting.desc: Augments are like lenses for the Sparks. Very useful for managing how Mana flows in the network of Mana Pools and other devices that use Mana. A perfect use is the Dominant Augment attached to the Spark over the Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate, allowing this Spark to pull Mana from ALL Sparks within its reach to power the plate.

betterquesting.name: More Like Swapping
betterquesting.desc: The Spark Tinkerer, when given a redstone signal, will swap out augments. If no augment is present in the Spark Tinkerer, it will remove the augment attached to the Spark.

betterquesting.name: Going Viral
betterquesting.desc:
Give one of these viruses to a horse. One turns the horse into a zombie horse, the other strips the flesh from its bones, leaving it skeletal.

Neither are palatable to The Dreamer but she recognizes there are strange people in the world with even stranger tastes.

betterquesting.name: Uplifted
betterquesting.desc:
The Shard of Laputa scoops out a chunk or more of land and lifts it into the sky above. There are twenty powerlevels with the lowest scooping a circular area 28 blocks in diameter. Each power increase to the shard increases the area by two blocks. No matter the level, the shard is a one-time use item.

To increase the power of the Shard, add more Gaia Spirits.

betterquesting.name: Battle Gaia II and its Minions
betterquesting.desc:
More difficult by far. Gear up and hammer down! And earn the Dice of Fate. Augment your floral defenses as well, with Potions, Pendants and persistence.

Battle Gaia II until you've earned each of the Relics, and gathered all of the Wills.

Good Luck. You're gonna need it.

betterquesting.name: A Wing and A Prayer
betterquesting.desc:
The Flgel Tiara grants the wearer limited flight. 

Read the entry in the Lexica Botania for more information.

betterquesting.name: Breathless
betterquesting.desc: The Globetrotter's Sash allows the wearer to travel at "incredible" speeds. 'Nuff said.

betterquesting.name: Manastorm Charge
betterquesting.desc: There is no better description for this destructive side of Mana. Even stormchasers avoid this menace.

betterquesting.name: Spawner Acquisition
betterquesting.desc: The Life Aggregator serves one purpose - to move a Monster Spawner. Once the spawner is placed inworld, the aggregator shatters. Well worth the price!

betterquesting.name: Prepare for Battle!
betterquesting.desc: The Gaia Spirit Ingot has no real use but one. To call the bigger sibling of Gaia.

betterquesting.name: Pristine Princesses
betterquesting.desc:
The Hiveacynth only seems to attract the Ignoble variety of Princesses. Their short lifespan interferes with productivity. Luckily, the Ignoble ladies can bathe in the glorious radiance of the Hibeescus to gain Pristine status. 

Only one Princess at a time will be accepted by the Hibeescus. It takes about two ingame days for it to cleanse the Princess.

betterquesting.name: Imperious and Industrious
betterquesting.desc:
Due to constraints of the questing process, only the byproducts of bee breeding are trackable. With that in mind, breed the following pairs to get the products:

Hive Bee refers to any of the bees from the wild hives. It doesn't matter if the combination is drone/princess or princess/drone to get the queen (product).

Hive + Hive = Common Queen (Honey Comb)

Hive + Common = Cultivated Queen (Honey Comb)

Common + Cultivated = Noble Queen (Dripping Comb: Honeydew, Honey Drop)
Common + Cultivated = Diligent Queen (Stringy Comb: Propolis, Honey Drop)

Cultivated + Noble = Majestic Queen (Dripping Comb)
Cultivated + Diligent = Unweary Queen (Stringy Comb)

Noble + Majestic = Imperial Queen (Royal Jelly, Dripping Comb)
Diligent + Unweary = Industrious Queen (Pollen Cluster, Stringy Comb)

Once you have the Imperial and Industrious Queens, set them up for production.

betterquesting.name: Traditional Alveary
betterquesting.desc:
We nod back to the roots of Forestry with the construction of the Alveary. Now that we have a copious supply of Royal Jelly, Pollen Clusters and Beeswax, it is time for you to build us an Alveary of our own.

The basic structure consists of 27 Alveary blocks in a 3x3x3 cube topped with slabs of your choice.

There are special blocks that can be manufactured with the Alveary blocks if adjustments to the Alveary environment need to be made.

betterquesting.name: Custom Made
betterquesting.desc:
Bees, Trees, and Butterflies. All three can be "custom made" by building a desired Gene Template from the appropriate Gene Samples. When building a template, not all the genes need to be present. However, the more complete the template, the less time you will spend recycling undesirable bees. Consider carefully whether you want to recycle Princesses. The pristine variety can be imprinted with a set of desirable genes, including overwriting the species.

By now you have the necessary bees to use the Mutatron to breed a Ferrous Queen. Ferrous bees only produce one drone. To increase the drones, the Ferrous Princess and the Ferrous Drone will need to be imprinted with a Genetic Template that contains the gene trait: "Fertility: 4". If you fail to imprint both, you will end up with drones that carry mixed traits that will not stack.

Once you have enough drones (keep at least one stack,) now you want to re-imprint the Ferrous Princess and a Ferrous Drone for production. Build a Genetic Template with the gene trait: "Fertility: 2" and a Genetic Template with the gene trait: "Speed: Fastest". This will ensure the highest production.

Hints:
For building a supply of drones, consider using "Lifespan: Shortest" and "Fertility: 4" in a Genetic Template.
For production, it's good to have "Speed: Fastest" and "Lifespan: Longest".

betterquesting.name: The Attack of the Clones
betterquesting.desc:
The Genetic Replicator will create a clone Queen for any of the full Genetic Templates. All traits must be present. All Genetic Templates contain 13 traits when full.

Use the DNA Extractor and the Protein Liquifier to provide the required materials to the Genetic Replicator. Not all protein will work. The DNA Extractor will accept any Bees, Trees or Butterflies. A sure source of protein are the raw varieties, so get to breeding your farm animals!

Queens acquired by this method are always Ignoble Stock.

betterquesting.name: Selective Breeding
betterquesting.desc: It appears the rumors were true!

betterquesting.name: Apprentice Blood Orb (Tier 2)
betterquesting.desc: Second in the tier of orbs is the Apprentice Blood Orb. Fill a Tier 2 Blood Altar with at least 5000 LP and throw in an Emerald. The Emerald will absorb the Life Essence and transmute into the Tier 2 Apprentice Blood Orb. To activate, right click the orb in air.

betterquesting.name: Magician's Blood Orb (Tier 3)
betterquesting.desc: Third in the tier of orbs is the Magician's Blood Orb. Fill a Tier 3 Blood Altar with at least 25000 LP and throw in a Block of Gold. The Block of Gold will absorb the Life Essence and transmute into the Tier 3 Magician's Blood Orb. To activate, right click the orb in air.

betterquesting.name: Transcendent Blood Orb (Tier 5)
betterquesting.desc: Fifth in the tier of orbs is the Transcendent Blood Orb. Fill a Tier 5 Blood Altar with at least 75,000 LP and throw in a Demon Blood Shard. The Demon Blood Shard will absorb the Life Essence and transmute into the Tier 5 Transcendent Blood Orb. To activate, right click the orb in air.

betterquesting.name: Lava Sigil
betterquesting.desc:
So a Lava Crystal, a Magma Cream and a Blank Slate met at the Six-Buckets Lava pool. They had a heated discussion about a bunch of mages bandying about words. In a fit of pique, Blank Slate swallowed the rest. Thus was created the Lava Sigil.

The Lava Sigil dispenses Lava sources for the low cost of 1000 LP per source block. Best put them into a tank. Just right click the tank to add one bucket of Lava. (oGreat for filling Smeltery tanks.r)

betterquesting.name: Catalyzing
betterquesting.desc: The next step in Alchemy (the first being a chemistry set) is the creation of a Simple Catalyst.

betterquesting.name: Demonic Slate
betterquesting.desc: Sticking Imbued Slates back in an Altar and infusing them with more LP will transmute them into Demonic Slates. Demonic Slates require a Tier Four Altar.

betterquesting.name: Room to Grow
betterquesting.desc:
With increased size of Blood Orbs comes a need for an increase in storage capacity for Life Essence in the Soul Network. Each Rune of the Orb increases Blood Orb LP base capacity by two percent per rune.

The Rune of Superior Capacity adds more buffer storage for the Blood Altar.

betterquesting.name: Which Came First?
betterquesting.desc: By the power of chemistry and a wee bit of blood, you can create new life. Chicken Pot Pie anyone?

betterquesting.name: Shards of Life
betterquesting.desc: By throwing a Weak Blood Shard into a Tier Three Blood Altar, it will transmute into a Life Shard. Using a Life Shard as a catalyst with three Weak Blood Shards in the Alchemic Chemistry Set will yield a Soul Shard. Mixing Life Shards and Soul Shards will yield a Crystal Cluster.

betterquesting.name: Soul Source
betterquesting.desc:
Use the Soul Transporter to visit the Soul Network Dimension. Be sure to carry a spare as there is no other way to return home.

While you are there, use a Soul Chunk Claimer to claim your chunk of the Soul Network.

betterquesting.name: Tier Two Sigils
betterquesting.desc:
All higher-tier sigils require steady LP to perform their functions. Right click to activate or deactivate. lRemember to deactivate when you're not using it. The consequences are brutal!r

The Void Sigil acts like a sponge, voiding fluids it comes into contact with.

The Air Sigil acts like a semblance of flight. The landing is a bit painful.

Sigil of the Fast Miner acts like a Speed enchantment.

The Sigil of Sight modifies the Divination Sigil to "see" the capacity of the Blood Altar buffer, and view the "crafting" phase and speed. It will no longer detect how much LP is stored in the Soul Network, or the tier level of the altar.

The Sigil of the Green Grove acts like Bonemeal.

betterquesting.name: How Do I Spell That?
betterquesting.desc:
The Spell Table, when next to the Blood Altar, allows for casting specific spells with an Unbound Crystal. The Spell Table requires a focus (nine possible options) and a paradigm (four possible options). Swapping out the spell focus and paradigm determines which spells will be active.

Later, more powerful spells will be available to you by use of complex spell mechanics. You will need to seek further guideance and tutelage from the "Sanguine Scientiem" and the Transcendent Mage Google.

(NOTE: A known bug is some combinations no longer work in the 1.7.10 version of the Blood Magic mod.)

betterquesting.name: Incensed
betterquesting.desc:
With the Incense Crucible, a bit more LP is extracted when using the Sacrificial Orb. There are five tiers of Incense that increase the LP from a minimum of 20 percent to 300 percent - Wood Ash, Byrrus, Livens, Viridis, and Purpura.

Each incense will last five uses. Use five Incense Crucibles per level (at five each, that will be 25 crucibles, effects are cumulative and will not work without the lower tier incense,) to gain maximum LP per extraction. 

You will know the incense is working because it will imbue an aura around the Sacrificial Orb. Once discharged (ostand near altar, hold right button to "power up", then release the button. The orb extracts nine hearts. Be sure to use potions, brews and other means to recover between sacrifices.r) you must be near the crucibles to reactivate the aura.

betterquesting.name: Blast!
betterquesting.desc: Now that you have your Magician's Blood Orb, and the Master Ritual Stone, perform the Ritual of Binding and transform the Apprentice Blood Orb into an Energy Blaster. It deals a great deal of damage using LP as its energy source.

betterquesting.name: Reagents and Catalysts and Bindings, Oh My!
betterquesting.desc:
Quoted excerpt from my personal apprenticeship notebook: 

"Render these materials to further progress in your alchemic academics. You will soon need a great deal of reagents when it's time to summon demons."

My master has an evil sense of humor... demons?

Oh, well. Time to make the bindings, catalysts, and reagents.

betterquesting.name: Top Slate
betterquesting.desc: Sticking Demonic Slates back in an Altar and infusing them with more LP will transmute them into Ethereal Slates. Ethereal Slates require a Tier Five Altar.

betterquesting.name: Acceleration Dislocation
betterquesting.desc: Rune of Acceleration increases the speed of the Rune of Dislocation. The maximum number of Acceleration Runes possible is 19. More are just a waste of resources.

betterquesting.name: Don't Fear The Reaper
betterquesting.desc: The Harvest Goddess Sigil harvests mature crops and immediately replants within a 3-block radius of the holder. It doesn't pick up dropped plants or seeds. This sigil is similar to the ritual "Reap of the Harvest Moon." AOE doesn't matter because portability is what makes this sigil special.

betterquesting.name: Transferrence
betterquesting.desc: After you have stolen the Life Essence from your neighbor's Soul Network, the Soul Transferrer will move the LP into your own Soul Network. (oOf course, you gotta have access to worlds where there ARE neighbors!r)

betterquesting.name: Livens
betterquesting.desc: Tier three incense. 'Nuff said.

betterquesting.name: Viridis
betterquesting.desc: Tier four incense. 'Nuff said.

betterquesting.name: Purpura
betterquesting.desc: Tier five incense. 'Nuff said.

betterquesting.name: Ritual Tools
betterquesting.desc:
Now that you have a Master Ritual Stone and blank Ritual Stones, it is time to create a Weak Activation Crystal and a Ritual Diviner. 

In addition to the Ritual Diviner, the blood mage requires a Ritual Dismantler to properly dismantle rituals which are no longer needed, in the way, or whatever excuse she may have for dismantling.

betterquesting.name: Bound Thaumium
betterquesting.desc: The power of binding crosses into the boundaries of the thaumaturge. Perform the Ritual of Binding on the following: Goggles of Revealing, Thaumium Chestplate, Thaumium Leggings, and Thaumium Boots

betterquesting.name: Death Shards
betterquesting.desc:
With bound blade in hand and activated, killing entities drops Weak Blood Shards. 

Collect a few. Collect a lot. For what comes next, frugal be you not.

NOTE: oWHEN you have your Master Blood Orb (next tier Blood Altar), you can dramatically increase your quantity of Weak Blood Shards by crafting one shard with an Imbued Slate, and the Master Blood Orb to power the processr.

betterquesting.name: Soul Corruption Crystallizer
betterquesting.desc: As your soul becomes more corrupted, the chances of really bad things happening increases multifold. Using the Soul Corruption Crystallizer will virtually negate the effects of corruption, just as long as it has reagents to keep it powered. Be diligent, you corrupted soul!

betterquesting.name: Binding Forge
betterquesting.desc:
The Soul Armour Forge is a single-purpose block. It serves as a focus to transform Filled Sockets into Bound Armor. But instead of using a crafting surface, the forge is placed in world with Filled Sockets surrounding it in the shape of the armor item you wish to "craft". Add items to the Filled Sockets to provide effects. (ohttps://ftbwiki.org/Bound_Armorr)

Once the pattern is built, right click the forge to activate.

There may come a time when the special attributes of the armor need to be suppressed. Rather than divesting each time, craft the Armour Inhibitor and carry it with you.

betterquesting.name: Issuing a Summons
betterquesting.desc:
Before you can actually combat, defeat, and tame a demon, you must build the Arcane Plinth and gird it with Arcane Pedestals. Once built, you will find the setup for the ritual in the Sanguine Scientiem under the chapter titled "The Demon Kin".

Once tamed, the demons will assist you in combat with mobs and other, untamed and untameable, demons.

To complete this quest, you must actually defeat an Elemental demon in order to acquire Demon Blood Shards.

betterquesting.name: Teleposer
betterquesting.desc:
Rather than walking, running, or flying from location to location, a simple teleport system is available to the blood mage. The system uses a Teleposer and Teleposition Focus per location. The most basic system will require two Teleposers and one Teleposition Focus PER Teleposer. Add a method to feed a redstone signal to the Teleposer.

Once placed at a location, right click the Teleposer with a Teleposition Focus. Travel to the destination and place the second Teleposer. Place the linked focus into the Teleposer. Now right click the second focus to set the coordinates and return to the first Teleposer. Insert the linked focus.

To use the system, stand on the Teleposer and activate. Both items and entities within the field of influence will be teleported. The more powerful foci will teleport larger volumes, so be sure the current location and the destination don't have any sensitive builds that will be disrupted when you activate the Teleposer.

betterquesting.name: I BIND THEE!!!
betterquesting.desc:
If you haven't already done so, bind the Weak Activation Crystal and the Ritual Diviner to yourself by right clicking in air. 

Select the desired ritual by shift right clicking the Ritual Diviner; in this case, cycle to the Ritual of Binding. 

Place the Master Ritual Stone and right click it with the Ritual Diviner. It will automatically construct the proper configuration for the Ritual Stones of the chosen ritual. Once the ritual is built, drop the item to be bound onto the Master Ritual Stone, then right click the stone with the Weak Activation Crystal. Before you do, make sure you have sufficient LP in you Soul Network and wear protection!!!

betterquesting.name: Catalysts and Bindings Strengthened
betterquesting.desc: As you continue your journey in alchemical brewing, stronger bindings, catalysts, and reagents are required.

betterquesting.name: Catalysts Condensed
betterquesting.desc: This is as far as your studies will be able to go with alchemical catalysts. Well done!

betterquesting.name: The Awakened Activation Crystal
betterquesting.desc: Using the Alchemic Chemistry Set, mix a Demon Blood Shard with some reagents, and the Weak Activation Crystal. It will awaken, allowing it to activate more powerful rituals.

betterquesting.name: Special Delivery
betterquesting.desc: To get the Sanguine Scientiem: Throw the Mail Order Catalog on the ground and wait.

betterquesting.name: Shielded
betterquesting.desc:
The Sigil of Supression temporarily removes any fluid source within a five block radius. Once it's disabled, or you move out of range, the sources will return. It works on any Forge fluid API fluids, such as Water, Lava or Oil. 

When you go on a walkabout, don't forget to carry this sigil.

betterquesting.name: Dusky Rituals
betterquesting.desc:
The power of the Ritual Diviner is limited with only four Elemental Inscription Tools (Earth, Air, Fire, Water). 

To gain access to more rituals, make two of the Elemental Inscription Tool: Dusk and a couple of Demonic Slates to strengthen your Ritual Diviner to handle more powerful rituals. A favorite ritual is the Well of Suffering. No more pricked fingers and passing out from blood loss.

betterquesting.name: A New Day is Dawning
betterquesting.desc: End of the line. Omega. Add Elemental Ritual Tool: Dawn, along with Ethereal Slate to power your Ritual Diviner. You now have the ability to build the ultimate ritual - Symmetry of the Omega.

betterquesting.name: OMEGA
betterquesting.desc:
OMEGA, end of the line. 15,000,000 LP just to activate the ritual "Symmetry of the Omega". The ritual coats the Bound Armor with the essence of the reagents powering the ritual. Fleeting is the effect but well worth it. There are four Omega options: Earth, Wind, Fire, Water.

The effects of the ritual only remain for a limited time (~15 min) and will disappear entirely if any part of the armor is removed, reverting the armor to its former state.

To increase the length of time Omega remains active, build the enclosure with Glyphs of Rigid Stability. Throw in a few Glyph of Arcane Potential and Glyph of the Adept Enchanter to gain multi-level enchantments.

(oAnd yes. To complete this quest, you must remove the chest plate to count.r)

betterquesting.name: Havahart
