betterquesting.desc: By now you've earned a few hearts. Now you can make them. No more fretting about losing Extra Life.

betterquesting.name: Ritual Fuel Storage
betterquesting.desc: Crystal Belljars are filled with Alchemic Reagents. Remember all those reagents you were warned to make lots of?

betterquesting.name: Ritual Fuels
betterquesting.desc: Now that you finally have a way to store reagents in bulk, it's time to use what you've learned and fill a few Crystal Belljars.

betterquesting.name: De Calc
betterquesting.desc:
The Alchemic Calcinator "melts" reagents. It has an internal buffer of 2000 AR (Alchemic Reagent) which then drains into the main holding tank. 

Use the Alchemic Calcinator to melt the reagents. 

Select the reagent in the Alchemic Calcinator with the Alchemic Router by shift right click.

Use the Alchemic Router to link source to destination by right clicking the source then destination. Valid destinations are Crystal Belljars, Alchemy Relays, and the Master Ritual Stone.

Use the Alchemic Cleanser to clear the destination.

Use the Alchemic Segmenter to lock a tank, when multiple tanks are available (like in Alchemy Relays,) to one reagent.

betterquesting.name: Link in a Chain
betterquesting.desc:
The Alchemy Relay is used to transfer reagents from a source to a destination. The relay has two tanks which can be locked using the Alchemic Segmenter. It's a touch tricky to get the sequence correct for reagent to flow smoothly. Even with both tanks containing different reagents, only one reagent at a time will flow.

To set up the relay, place the relay within a few blocks of the source. Place a lever next to the relay and turn it on to disable the relay.

Select the first reagent by shift right click source. Right click Alchemy Relay. IF the chat message "Tank now has (0,1,2) tank(s) set to: (reagent)", right click the relay until it shows "1".

Repeat the process for the second reagent. Both tanks are now set to different reagents.

Now use the Alchemic Router to set up flow: In air, shift right click to clear source coordinates.

Select the first reagent, right click the source followed by right click the relay. The first reagent will now flow into the relay. Repeat the process for the second reagent. You should be able to "see" both reagents are now in the relay (while holding any of the Alchemic tools.)

Follow the exact same steps from the Alchemy Relay to the destination. Oh, and remember to flip the levers. (oIf all else fails, Google is your friend.r)

betterquesting.name: The Key to Your Soul
betterquesting.desc: The Key of Binding will bind everything in your personal inventory with one click.

betterquesting.name: Stabby Stabby
betterquesting.desc:
The Dagger of Sacrifice works only within three blocks of the Blood Altar. Mobs are sacrificed with a single blow. Otherwise, limp noodles do more damage...

Slaughtering farm animals provides 250 LP, hostile mobs 500 LP, and villagers 2,000 LP.

betterquesting.name: Manipulation Tool
betterquesting.desc:
From "Delving into the Darkness"

"The Sanguine Shifter is a way to upgrade the Altar Manipulator. While items can be inserted via hoppers, there is no Way to take them out. Do not fear! The Sanguine Shifter is here! Right clicking this item to any side of the Altar Manipulator but its bottom, and placing an inventory on this side will make the Altar Manipulator output its items to this inventory. Hooray!"

betterquesting.name: "This...is my boomstick!"
betterquesting.desc:
...ouch!...

o...may cause environmental damage...r

betterquesting.name: Perfect Imperfection
betterquesting.desc:
The Imperfect Ritual Stone has a purpose. A bit limited in the ritual department but it will allow a small bit of control over your environment. There are three templates available for the rituals. Place the template on top of the Imperfect Ritual Stone, then right click the stone to activate.

With a Block of Coal and 5000 LP, summon a strong Zombie.

With a Block of Lapis, day becomes night.

With a water source block (bucket or Water Sigil), a thunderstorm to beat all thunderstorms is called.

betterquesting.name: Seeing is Believing
betterquesting.desc:
From the pages of "Delving into the Darkness:"

"The Blood Interface permits automated management of your LP network by Redstone ... In order to take any measurements, the Interface must be loaded with a Blood Magic Orb, the maximum amount of LP it can measure is limited by the Orb's cap."

betterquesting.name: Ritual For Task Automation
betterquesting.desc: To put it simply, the ritual "Orchestra of the Phantom Hands" allows you to move items from one location to another using an Input Routing Focus and an Output Routing Focus (numerous options available.) An excellent way to auto feed fuel to furnaces and extract the finished product, or route stone into the altar for Blank Slates, etal. The possibilities are limited only by your imagination. You could say it's a storage networking ritual.

betterquesting.name: ME Power to ME Controller
betterquesting.desc:
The Energy Acceptor converts RF into AE.

The Vibration Chamber burns coal and converts it to AE.

The Energy Cell stores AE allowing the ME System to remain operational for a short time if main power is inadvertently lost. There is a Dense Energy Cell with eight times the storage capacity.

betterquesting.name: Smart Network
betterquesting.desc:
The basic ME System has only 8 channels that it will support. In order to expand the capabilities of your AE2 System, you will need an ME Controller. 

The ME Controller is the brain that controls the nervous system of the AE2 system. Up to seven ME Controllers can be strung together in a line and/or perpendicular to each other. As long as that 'rule' is followed, there are many configurations that will allow for a significant number of available channels.

Each exposed side of an ME Controller provides 32 channels for setting up some awesome automation. The ME Dense Cable will carry up to 32 channels. From it, ME Cables are attached that use up to eight channels. The ME Smart Cable and the ME Dense cable will provide a visual indication of the number of channels in use. When the number of channels used exceed the capacity of the associated cable, the additional connections will not work.

Cables are easily managed using colored cables or by using Cable Anchors to keep cables from connecting where you don't want them to go. They're also great for making covers for the ME Cables. Bonus: Cable Anchors act like ladders and can be climbed.

Finally, there are a couple of advanced tools to help with network management.

betterquesting.name: Crafting Computer
betterquesting.desc:
The Molecular Assemblers work okay for single recipes but work even better when there is a crafting processor setup to automatically craft multiple, and/or more complex, recipes. The minimum size processor setup requires a Crafting Storage block.

When placing the blocks for the processor, the pattern will change when the parts are in a useable shape (a box, no gaps, any size or shape will work.)

betterquesting.name: Automation Programming
betterquesting.desc:
Patterns are used to automate repetitive crafting and processing tasks.

The Pattern Terminal is used to make crafting or processing Encoded Patterns for use in an ME Interface or a Molecular Assembler. 

The terminal requires the crafting items to be available in the system for pattern creation. A processing pattern requires the player to set the pattern and end product to create the Encoded Pattern.

The Pattern Encoder is used to make crafting Encoded Patterns only but does not require the crafting or end product items to be available for creation of the pattern.

betterquesting.name: Inscripted
betterquesting.desc: The Inscriber accepts only one recipe component in each of the input slots. With the Advanced Inscriber, a full stack can be loaded in each slot.

betterquesting.name: Wirelessly Working
betterquesting.desc:
Unlike P2P tunnels that require a cable and power to operate, the Wireless Connectors allow the transfer of 32 channels wirelessly.

Set up in pairs by attaching to an ME Heavy Cable. Then use the Wireless Setup Kit to connect them. Right click the first connector, then right click the second. They are now linked and you can look at the connector to see its connection.

betterquesting.name: Distilled
betterquesting.desc: The Distillation Pattern Encoder allows you to encode Blank Patterns with the recipes of Essentia of various aspects obtained from the item or block during smelting in Alchemical Furnace or similar machines.

betterquesting.name: Breaking Up is Hard to Do
betterquesting.desc:
Use the Formation Plane and the Annihilation Plane to automate the task of processing silk-touched ore blocks that result in dropped resources, like Diamonds, Coal, Lapis Lazuli, etc.

With the addition of a processing Encoded Pattern, the setup can also be used to get flint from Gravel.

The Identity Annihilation Plane uses silk touch to pick up blocks without breaking them for their drops.

betterquesting.name: Wireless Access
betterquesting.desc:
While working, it's not always convenient to run back to the terminal to pull items out of AE2 storage. Use the Wireless Terminal instead. 

To extend the reach of the terminal, additional Wireless Access Points may be added. Each point uses 8 AE/t and one channel.

To link the Wireless Terminal to the AE2 system requires the use of a Security Terminal to program it.

Use the Biometric Card to add authorized users to the Security Terminal. Several options are available to limit the secondary's access.

betterquesting.name: Golem Access
betterquesting.desc:
The Wireless Golem Backpack allows the Golem to access the AE2 system as it would a chest.

To attach to a Golem, double right click the Golem.

betterquesting.name: Portable AE2
betterquesting.desc:
The Portable Cell is like an extended backpack. It can carry up to 27 items or multi-stacks, much better than a normal backpack. 

Once the cell contains items, it cannot be put into the AE2 storage. Instead, it will fit into the slot of a ME Chest.

Each ME chest uses one AE channel.

betterquesting.name: Getting a Charge
betterquesting.desc: The Charger will charge any item that accepts a charge. Accepts power via the bottom or top from any power source.

betterquesting.name: Fluix Crystals
betterquesting.desc: In a pool of water, throw in a Charged Certus Quartz, a Nether Quartz and a Redstone dust. They will transform into two Fluix Crystals.

betterquesting.name: Everything Matters
betterquesting.desc:
The Matter Condenser is a fantastic way to dispose of all your unwanted resources. Install either a 1K or 64K ME Storage Component. Once you've fed it enough resources (256 items for a Matter Ball or 256,000 items for a Singularity,) it will transform the storage component into the desired object.

Throw the Singularity and an Ender Dust next to a block of Tiny TNT and ignite it. The resulting explosion will fuse them into a paired Quantum Entangled Singularity.

betterquesting.name: Quantum Entanglement
betterquesting.desc:
Build a frame of ME Quantum Ring blocks around an ME Quantum Link Chamber. Once the multiblock structure forms, place a Quantum Entangled Singluarity in the chamber. Build a matching assembly at the desired remote location.

Connect the assembly to the AE2 system with an ME Dense Cable to maximize the available channels to the remote assembly. Connect another ME Dense Cable to the remote assembly and temporarily provide power to the remote location to activate the link. You will know the bridge is properly activated when you can view the contents of the AE2 system via an ME Terminal at the remote site.

betterquesting.name: Playing With Cards
betterquesting.desc:
There are a variety of Cards used in upgrading AE2 assemblies. Each card lists the blocks that it can be used in. Cards do not stack within the blocks.

There is one card called the Memory Card that is used to copy and paste configurable blocks. Shift-right-click to copy, right click to paste.

betterquesting.name: Like Peering Through a Keyhole
betterquesting.desc:
Peer-to-peer connectors, called P2P for short, allow for a way of compressing channels over long distances, using ME Cables and linked P2P Tunnels. Use the Memory Card to link tunnels together. Remember to add glass fiber cable to bridge the gap and provide power to the P2P Tunnels.

There are variants that allow for manipulating fluids, items, light, rf and Redstone. The most basic is the P2P Tunnel - ME. Each variant is created by right-clicking the installed P2P Tunnels with an appropriate material to "program" the tunnel.

betterquesting.name: Cut Here
betterquesting.desc: The ME Toggle Bus provides a way to disconnect assemblies from drawing AE power when not in use. The biggest power hog is the Crystal Growth Accelerator. To place the toggle, remove the cable going to the accelerator, place the toggle, then replace the cable. Use a lever to control the toggle.

betterquesting.name: It's Cellular
betterquesting.desc: The Cell Workbench allows for the pre-programming of cells and related cell-based items. These items are: Cell, Matter Cannon and ME Storage Cells. Pre-programming includes adding selected items and cards.

betterquesting.name: I'm A Convert
betterquesting.desc: The ME Storage Monitor is all fine and good, but being able to throw bulk items into storage (I'm looking at you, Cobblestone!) is even better. Right click the ME Conversion Monitor with the item you want to work with. Lock the monitor by right clicking with a Certus/Quartz Wrench. Then, with shift-double-right-click, throw all of the same item into the AE2 system. With just right-click, you can remove a stack of the item at a time.

betterquesting.name: Essentially Cellular
betterquesting.desc: Like the Cell Workbench but for working with Essentia cells.

betterquesting.name: Smelt You!
betterquesting.desc:
The Entropy Manipulator is auto-smelting at your fingertips, so-to-speak. Most blocks that can be smelted will respond to this staff. Ore blocks become ingots. Cobblestone becomes Stone. Right click the target block to smelt it. 

Some blocks can be reverted to the original block, like Stone to Cobblestone. Shift right click to revert it. Some blocks, like sand to glass, will not revert.

betterquesting.name: Storage Cleanup
betterquesting.desc: The ME IO Port is used to clean up storage cells by routing the inventory to other cells.

betterquesting.name: Multi-Tool
betterquesting.desc: The Matter Cannon is a very nice multipurpose tool. Provided with the right ammo, the cannon can mine multiple blocks or damage mobs.

betterquesting.name: Applied Engineering
betterquesting.desc: Automate everything - no really, everything.

betterquesting.name: Assembly Line
betterquesting.desc: Machines are the foundation of a factory.

betterquesting.name: Bees and Trees
betterquesting.desc: Glorious mysterious amazing bees. The Jaded One's favorite method of ...well everything

betterquesting.name: Botanical Engineering
betterquesting.desc: Most of Botania's mysteries are covered in the Lexica Botania. However, this world messes with the normal nature of things, so the Jaded One felt some encouragements might be in order... just to make sure you get a firm foundation in the subject. Botania is all about Flower Power!

betterquesting.name: For the Hoarding
betterquesting.desc: None of these quests are required to complete the map. They are provided because many have requested them.

betterquesting.name: Learning to Skyblock!
betterquesting.desc: You may be continuing a journey or you may be starting out fresh. Either way, this series of tasks was hand-selected to help you learn how to survive in the void.

betterquesting.name: Mob Hunter
betterquesting.desc: Many terrible monsters inhabit the void. Destroy them before they destroy you. And ignore those M.E.T.A guys. They are a bit silly.

betterquesting.name: Mystical Blood
betterquesting.desc: Blood is life... and also creepy. By sacrificing some of your own Life Essence, or someone else's, you can create powerful rituals and tools. Just be careful, the dark side is tempting.

betterquesting.name: Power Grid
betterquesting.desc: Give me the power... all of it... NOW!

betterquesting.name: Sky Farm
betterquesting.desc: Food appears to be quite scarce. And yet your stomach refuses to go without. The only solution is to learn the fine arts of cooking and farming. Or, at least enough to keep from starving.

betterquesting.name: Storage Wars
betterquesting.desc: Most people find that organizing their items in some form of storage system greatly increases their efficiency. On the other hand, some people prefer the method used by the Chaotic One wherein everything is tossed into the same spot. Whichever you prefer, there is a storage solution for you.

betterquesting.name: Thaumaturgy
betterquesting.desc: Technology is not the only power in the world. Magic can do many things when used correctly.

betterquesting.name: Tinker Toys
betterquesting.desc: Leveling tools and upgrading them can lead to unique combinations.
